Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: JANICE H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I left the Princess Royale to come here because the service at the PR was awful (see my upcoming review). Not only was the price REASONABLE, but the staff was AWESOME. The rooms were clean and the environment was truly pleasant. We had stayed in OC for two days and I didn't feel like my vacation started until we checked into CITS Hotel. They also allowed us a late \check out when I wasn't feeling well the next day. What made it better was that my boyfriend was completely satisfied with the room and we are excited to come back next month...all because of one night, thanks to the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Coconuts was horrible!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joel B
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to Coconuts Beach Bar and Grill which is the "restaurant" of the Catle In The Sand Hotel. I put "Restaurant" in quotes because it would be offensive to all the other restaurants of the world for me to call it that. Once we were seated it to 15 minutes for the waitress to come take our drink order. I'm a very laid back guy but the place was more than half empty. Once the drinks did arrive ( Margarita for me, water for my mom) It was god awful. Tequila, Triple sec and lime juice...boom you got a Margarita, how do you mess that up?? My mom asked for lemon with her water but the lemon slices was so dry no juice would come out. The food came out surprisingly fast. The chicken taco's were not good. Are tacos supposed to be served cold?? The chicken would have been good if if wasn't bone dry. I still left a good tip for the waitress becasue the quality of food and drink isn't her fault. I took my mom out again the next night to a different place of her choice since my choice wasn't something I would consider a nice sit down expericence.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in ocean front efficiency. Room was roomy best view is from 3rd floor and above. Restuarant for breakfast buffet and lunch on site. Free wifi, outdoor bar, vollyball court. Very large pool with diving board. Our kitchen had everything we needed tucked into a very compact area. Balconies overlooking ocean are very small and chairs on them are not very comfortable. All in all we had an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “OLD & WORE OUT”
Reviews.Author: mybailey114
Reviews.Content: I looked at this place on line it looked totally different then when I got there. I also was reading online that it was renovated last year. Yeah where at? I stayed in Room # 22. Everything was old, rustic & wore out. The only thing that looked new to me was the tv's & dvd players. The only thing nice about the hotel is the pool & its location. You are right near everything. If your use to staying in a nice hotel don't be fooled like I was by the word RENOVATION!!!! The pictures are deceiving!!

Reviews.Title: “"Sunshine" on a cloudy Day!”
Reviews.Author: teresa f
Reviews.Content: Visited the Castle over the Labor Day weekend, unfortunately the good weather wasn't with us. I can honestly say that if it weren't for Lady Sunshine our children would have been miserable! There would have been nothing else for the kids to do at this hotel when it rains! When the sky opened up my 3 kids ages 14, 11 and 3 all ran into the "Kid's Activities" tent to find the most lovely and beautiful heart of a Lady called "Lady Sunshine". She is amazing. The face and body painting were awesome. Very professional and artistic! She kept them busy with arts&crafts and balloons. When the weather permitted they were outside making amazing bubbles! Our favorite activity was "message in a bottle". Lady Sunshine supplied everything they needed to fill bottles with sand, shells and a message that they cold actually mail to a Loved one! My Middle daughter mailed hers to her Gram in Florida! I can't say enough about Lady Sunshine and her program. She is definitely the reason we will return next year. As far as the hotel itself goes... it was fine. It's a beach hotel/resort. The building(s) are very old, rustic, it's not a bad thing! You just have to keep that in consideration. I felt it was clean, but showed signs of the Oceans wear and tear and unfortunately, even though our North Bay view room was newly refurbished it had a very bad wet, moldy smell when you walked in! The rugs felt a little damp, I assume this is normal for a beach resort... or someone overflowed the bathtub at some point and those carpets haven't dried out. Other than that... the room was clean. New furniture and bedding. Bathroom very tight and not so updated. Hotel was booked for Holiday weekend, therefore this was the only category avail.. Next time I will try a Ocean View with a balcony! We loved Coconuts bar and grill! Great atmosphere, live music every afternoon, great for lunch and drinks! 2 for 1 from 4-6! We loved the pool! They pool is an Olympic size pool with a spring board! Lot's of fun! and the The Lifeguards were all awesome! Especially Emily.. I found her out there early in the morning cleaning the pool. And what a wonderful job she does at keeping this huge pool clean! It was sparkling! And you can't say that for many pools in Ocean City! There is no indoor pool. There is a small room with some pinball machines downstairs (not worth visiting!) Actually, that is one area where I think they need to improve.. the Lower Level... along with the "game room" there is a restaurant. Went down to check it out for breakfast and it's just not appealing down there and I was a little turned off. Apparently the cleaning people have their storage room down there and they were in and out with there carts. Didn't eat down there! Prefer to eat upstairs, outside at Coconuts! We loved the beach and the beach access.. they even have waitress service at the beach! that's definitely a nice plus! Wish the Castle would consider investing in a jungle gym or pirate ship for the little ones to play on in the sand ! maybe near the volleyball court.... that would be nice... We stayed at another hotel in August and they had a pirate ship... it kept my little one busy for hours!!!! This is the only thing that he really missed and asked for! So overall I think this is a great beach resort! We will try it again next summer! Especially for the "kids activities" with Lady Sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: PatinMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our family stayed here August 24-25 and were not disappointed. Our room was on the 5th floor with only one elevator. However, even though we had to wait some for the elevator, it was not a problem. The room was neat and clean and the beds were comfortable but a little soft as were the pillows. The staff were all pleasant. Unfortunately, they could not stop the all-day rain! They all stayed cheerful, nonetheless. We even got to sit on the beach between rain showers! We were glad to have the Coconuts Bar right in the courtyard. Hooray for Tipsy Turtles!

Reviews.Title: “Kids Activities”
Reviews.Author: Marilena22
Reviews.Content: I would certainly recommend this hotel for all it has to offer especially the well planned and enjoyable children's activities. Lady Sunshine and Lady J gave my children something to look forward to almost every day of the week, from puppet shows, magic shows, to face painting and arts and crafts. The activities would appeal to children of all ages. The shows are meant to stimulate the imagination and bolster self esteem. Please do visit Castle in the Sand as it is a well run family owned hotel which appeals to the child in all of us.

Reviews.Title: “fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: anthony5179
Reviews.Content: this was our tenth year straight! we would not be going back year after year if we didnt have a great time. its a great place for kids (we have four) and adults. this year three other relatives and their families joined us for a wonderful family experience. we all plan to return next year for another week of fun in the sun. when it comes to a summer family vacation the castle in the sand is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: PiggyHd1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good inasfar as the location, though it's not right on the boardwalk. That would have made it better for nighttime activities with the kids. The access to the beach was amazing and the view from the Waverly third floor was awesome. The air conditioning worked very well and the room itself was nice. Don't get me wrong it's certainly not the Ritz, but it was clean and spacious. My two biggest complaints are: 1. The WIFI WAS HORRIBLE! We called to the main desk and they said it depends on how many people are using it and that it works better in the hallway because that's where the units are. Well who the heck is going to sit in The hall to get WIFI? I also tried to get on at 4:45am. I doubt there were alot of people online at that hour. 2. The staff didn't tell us much upon registering. We had to pretty much fend for ourselves and figure things out. Housekeeping was great and couldn't do enough for us. Little Miss Sunshine was great with the kids. Thy really enjoyed that! Overall a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “I looked for great service and a decent night's stay but...”
Reviews.Author: jenne1017
Reviews.Content: I am not one to be too picky about hotels on the beach. I am used to having rather bare bones, but I also want the proprietors to make up for that with location and service. Sadly, we got neither. We made a reservation directly on their website, so it wasn't like it was a pricelined room where they stick you in a wherever - we paid them directly. Now, I THOUGHT I clicked on a king size bed room with a partial view. I didn't notice until too late that the confirmation said " 2 queens, no view." Was that worth the $260 we paid for one night? Not so much. But, it was on me to check the reservation which I didn't until too late. We arrived 3 hours prior to check-in. We gave our name and were asked for a $10 cash key deposit (no where did the confirmation say this). But we had time to go grab cash - they called after about an hour. We went to the room - 28 in Castle South - and it was right by the stairs (noise issue) overlooking the pool (noise issue). The room had an ancient feel to it - so while it was relatively clean, it was far from new and smelled like stale smoke or pee or mildew. While we changed, we were greeted by housekeeping not knocking but just coming in. Honest mistake but she should have knocked (all the housekeeping staff were pretty nice). We tried twice to log into the "free wireless". The first time I went down, the young woman at the front desk said I should reboot (we couldn't access it via our cell phones too) because that building "had the best reception because the front desk was right in it". We decided to go out for a bit and come back. We did, in time for happy hour and got our 2 for 1 drinks (the only good thing aside from location) and hit the beach between raindrops. We were impressed with the grounds but just not the rooms. While the kitchenette was nice, all the utensils and such had to be washed before we ate from them. And that stale smoke smell just was hard for us. The beds were very worn and uncomfortable (there was a valley on each side of each bed) - the pillows were very soft, almost non existent. I went down later after dinner because I still had no internet (first, it was raining, nay pouring. So we had time to kill. Second, I had to hand in something due that evening). I was told first that I wasn't doing it right, despite showing them a picture on my phone of available networks and Castle in the Sand not being one of them. I brought my computer down and after 3 people trying, there was service outside in the rain by the patio (apparently the server is in the building with the restaurant/ice cream parlor). I was instructed to go down there if I needed internet. This was not really ok - but I stood on a garbage can under an awning to shield me from the rain to hand in what was due - then ran back to the room. I was awake until 2a with what only sounded like moving furniture (??) and then stomping (up the outside stairwell by our door I presume). We wanted to love this place. We really did. We love charm and loved the idea. But for $260? This was not worth it. Maybe if we had an ocean view room, or were away from the stairwell. But every room should be as good as your worst, IMHO. Not as bad as it. If we were staying longer than a night, we would have switched rooms after that really bad night of sleep (5 hours?). Had I known about the noise levels before we unpacked, I would have complained.

Reviews.Title: “The best kids entertainment!”
Reviews.Author: Es P
Reviews.Content: I have to say the entertainment they have for the kids, is amazing it totally made my kids vacation. It's all they talk about, Lady j and Sunshine are amazing! We will defenitely go back just for the kids entertaiment alone. Keep upmthe awesome work ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Summer 2012 - Aug. 18-25”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: Love it at Castle in the Sand. We love all the activities they have for the kids this is my 3rd year going there. Mrs. Sunshire and Miss J are awesome. I have twin girls 3 yrs of age and a son who is 7 yrs of age. My twins looked forward to Mrs. Sunshine everyday she was there from 2-6pm I revolved my vacation around her. We would go to the beach in the morning and then Mrs. Sunshine and the pool. My one twin loved the face paintings everyday and my other twin loved all the activities she did with the twins. They did balloons, tatoos, face painting, crafts and pirate day on Wed. and a puppet show on Thursday. It was awesome we had a great time this week and will see you next year. Castle in the sand is a great location for a family with kids. There is a pool, Mrs. Sunshine (children activities everyday 2-6pm), movie night on Tuesday, breakfast buffet (children eat free), cocunuts bar and grill. Love it there. We will keep coming back because of the kids activities with Mrs. Sunshine and MIss J. The rooms and Cottages are ok - do need a little upgrading and the a/c will freeze you out but overall I think it is a really nice place to take your children and make memories. LOve ya Mrs. Sunshine and Miss J - see ya next summer. Tracy

Reviews.Title: “The kids entertainment is phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: 517Travelbug
Reviews.Content: Sunshine and Jane are just incredible! They run the children's entertainment at the hotel and they are wonderful. Each day they have a schedule of crafts, performances and activities for children of all ages. They are creative, patient, enthusiastic and energetic. They have been doing this for many years and don't seem the least bit tired. They really connect with the kids and have a warm, approachable demeanor. They share their artistic energy with anyone who stops by! They are organized and have their system down pat. These two women make this a number 1 family-friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great value, questionable internet”
Reviews.Author: tbontb
Reviews.Content: One of the other reviews warned "don't be fooled by the pictures". They are right, CITS is not as nice as the pictures make it look, but while no one would consider it 'upscale', it is clean, the facilities are new enough (not run down), it's reasonably roomy, and it is a tremendous value for the money. Families especially will enjoy it. The extra bit: the staff were so friendly and helpful it raises everything up a notch. They were so friendly I kept upping the tip to the cleaning staff. Check-in and check-out were a breeze, the pool is big and clean, the outside bar/restaurant/lounge looks nice, and they even have beach waitress service. Two warnings: (1) Internet service varied from non-existent to poor to almost adequate. I called several times, they tried things, but no consistent improvement. This is the only reason I don't give it a "5". (2) They have several buildings; I was only in the "Waverly", your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Great kids program!”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Castle in the Sand for over 10 years. We keep coming back mostly because of the kids activities hosted by Lady Sunshine and Lady J. They have taught all four of my kids how to juggle and they still do it today thanks to them! Face painting is the favorite for my younger ones. They can't wait each year to come back to see them. We usually stay in the bayside penthouse rooms, no view, but a decent room for the price. They have many other style of rooms available. The location is a few blocks from the start of the bordwalk, so you can walk along the street then hit the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on beach”
Reviews.Author: Jacko7676
Reviews.Content: Location was great right on beach. Great for families as the kids activities fun and pool has diving board. The outdoor bar and restaurant was cool but our food was awful. Bathroom was dirty when we arrived called front desk they sent someone straight away. Had to call again few minuteslater as my husband hurt his foot on carpet tack as the carpet strip was missing. We had a condo it smelled musty.we had to move to hotel room it was nicer as we stayed extra night .it needs a total make over . But it is great because it's on beach away from boardwalk which is good.waitress service on beach is nice touch too. Don't have high expectations and you will be happy with this place. The staff were very nice too and lady sunshine who runs kids club is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Older and quirky...but very family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTerps
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Castle in the Sand during a recent visit to OC. First, they hosted an amazing surfing camp for children with autism that is organized by the Surfer's Healing group so there was a very special tone in the hotel in general during our visit. The rooms are certainly older and worn, but the cleaning staff was busy and cleaned the room early each day. They have a great beach and a very large pool. The activities area/schedule they have for kids is incredibly unique and not something you would expect in Ocean City. During our visit, the woman organizing the activities did facepainting that was fantastic (elaborate and beautiful)! There were bubbles, picture frame decorating, games....all appropriate for the beach. (We had just returned from an upscale resort a few days prior where the "kids activities" in August included painting Halloween and Easter magnets?!?!) If you are traveling with children, that could be reason enough to stay here! The bar/volleyball area has a great feel. The 2-for-1 happy hour was certainly a plus! This is not typically the type of hotel we stay in when we travel, but I must admit that there is something very special about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: We were there from July 22-27th 2012.We have been staying at this hotel for 20+ years. They have always made us feel very welcomed and will do everything in their power to make your stay wonderful. This hotel has something for everybody: kids entertainment, volley ball, food service on the beach, and 2 great restaurants. They have made some wonderful improvement to the rooms this year.

Reviews.Title: “Promises kept and then some”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine E
Reviews.Content: All the promises made by this hotel were kept -- how wonderful! Castle in the Sand was accurate in its description of the accommodations -- yes, the rooms are worn and tired and yes, it's perfect for a family beach vacation! The best parts: BEACH! The sand is soft and clean and there are miles of it to explore! Life guards are professional (no reading or texting while on duty in the chair) Rentals Chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards are all available and in excellent condition. Pool -- A pool is just a pool unless it has a diving board! The diving board turned the pool into a playground for everyone. Adults and kids in silly dive contests are fun for everyone. Coconuts -- This restaurant is terrific -- outside next to the beach volleyball net so we can watch a game (there seems to always be a game going) watch a movie at night projected onto a wall while everyone eats dinner and free popcorn (Finding Nemo -- loved it) -- listen to live music in the afternoon and at night (great bands that played great music) Room - Ours was 103 / ground floor. We walked out the back and around a dune to a spectacular ocean full of colorful umbrellas and colorful people all playing together. I didn't care if the bedding was brand new only that it was clean -- it was. I didn't care if the carpet was new only that it was clean -- it was. I didn't care if the bathroom grout was white and bright only that it was clean -- it was. Staff - Ready and willing to make us as happy as possible. We had noisy people above and with one phone call, the situation was taken care of AND I didn't feel like a buzz-kill for complaining. The hotel manager was kind and understanding with me and with the people above us. Well done. We will return next year and wouldn't stay any place else. I hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “BEST kids program in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: The kids' program is among the best you will find anywhere and is reason enough to stay here if you have kids. Lady Sunshine and Lady Jay go above and beyond to make kids' time in the kids program memorable (face painting, tatoos, and many take home memories to be made - too much to tell!). Truly a stand-out part of what this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Another great time in July at the Castle”
Reviews.Author: Gumby_52
Reviews.Content: I have been going here for 11 out of the last 15 years. We have seen all of the improvements made while making indelible memories for our children, the biggest of which included the huge patio, dinner, party space between the buildings and the dunes. The service has always been great here. A great time !

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand Hotel Ocean City Maryland”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey T
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to OCMD for the last 18 years. For the past 17 years, we have stayed at the Castle in the Sand Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location close to everything yet far enough away to feel like you are on a tropical island. The staff at the hotel treat you like family. They do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel has updated most of the rooms in the last few years. The view from our room in the South building remains untouched because it is perfect. The restaurant/beach bar are great. Proximity to beach could not be any better. There are many hotels in OCMD, but we always go back to the Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, food, and beach.”
Reviews.Author: Bob D
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here for many years. Always an enjoyable experience. Has many convienences, on the beach, large pool, close to everything. Food on the beach is always good and has good drinks and entertainment. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “nice location for oc; beds are old, front desk is cold and non-responsive”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: The location for OC is great if you are travelling with kids. The rooms are old (cinder block walls) but for a beach hotel fine. Great views from higher floors. The room attendant we had was wonderful. The front desk folks, on the other hand, were some of the coldest, least helpful people we've experienced. We made reservations six months ahead to make sure we could have three rooms together--two facing the water, one across the hall facing the bay. We did the reservation in Jnanuary for that reason. And, we called the night before to reassure that the rooms would be together. When we checked in, no such luck. We were on the same floor but the third room (bay-side) was far down the hall. When we complained at the front desk, the first fellow (who must have been in law school at some point) said that all the hotel promised was across the hall. Well, across the hall to us meant across the hall, not down the hall and across. The manager on duty said there was nothing he could do. When we explained we had made reservations to make sure we got the rooms we wanted, all he could offer was, oddly enough, to make reservations for next year--not what we wanted at that point. On check-out, the clerk on duty was equally cold. For instance, we had a 93 year old woman with us who had a difficult time getting across the street. Parking next to the building we were in is sparse. So we wanted to check out, drive the car up to the building, get the elderly woman from the room, and then bring the key down. Not possible she said. Can't check out without her getting the key. And, at that point, she snidely also said that we were also 45 minutes late in checking out (1145AM)--never could figure out why except she wanted to make some point. So, our 93 year old grandmother slowly did the walk. In my experience most hotels try to make the hello and goodbye positive experiences. Our stay this year at this hotel was the opposite. Oh, by the way, the bed that comes with the couch was incredibly old and lumpy. We got it replaced after the first night. So check it out when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lovesgetaways32
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the Waverley Place building on the first floor. You can't see the ocean from there but we knew that when we booked it. It was nice for my two boys to be able to play in the sand in front of the room. There are lawn chairs that you can sit on out in front of your room and there are some palm trees for shade if you want. My parents stayed on the third floor of the North Suite but they said the heat from the air conditioner blowing on their balcony made it too hot to sit out on theirs. Their was hot air coming out on our balcony too but at least we were able to sit out away from it being on the first floor. The room was clean and the cleaning crew was friendly. I also liked that we had a roll out couch along with our two queen size beds so that my 9 year old could have a bed to himself. There was a band that would play during the day at their bar and grill but we were always at the beach during that time. On Saturday night they had a nice raggae band playing while we ate dinner. For the price of the room per night I personally would check into some other hotels to see if I could find something a little cheaper. They do have condo rooms behind the main hotel that are not ocean front that are cheaper and might be worth a try. The only reason we booked at this resort was because my sister got married on the beach and my whole family was staying at this resort. I am not into the bar seen and that seemed to be some of the focus at this resort. I was happy to know that I could still be away from the action with my two kids with us though. There is a big pool with a diving board and there are kids activities during happy hour at the bar in the afternoon but we did not take part in them, too busy swimming in the waves.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeDowningtownPA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay with my hubby, daughter-in-law, and my 5yr. old grandson at the castle in the sand and it was a very nice and very clean hotel. When we got there are room was not ready yet because it was only 10:00 am but they took our cell # and said to enjoy the pool and beach and they would call us as soon as the room was ready. Our room was ready by 11:30 and we able to check into our room. We stayed in one of the castle north suites on the second floor oceanfront and it was very nice. We had a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a flat screen tv, a nice size bathroom with a tub and shower combination, a nice kitchen with a full size refrig., a stove, microwave, coffeemaker, dishes, glasses, utensils, ect. a nice table and chairs, livingroom with a big desk, sofa that opened up to gueen size bed flat screen tv and a nice balcony with a table and chairs and a nice view of the ocean. We had lunch at the coconuts beach bar and grill and the food was good.Had some ice cream at their take a dip ice cream shop and it was pretty good(ben&jerrys). They had a little beach area next to the beach bar and grill with beach loungers and you could just relax there if you did not want to go down on the beach. the pool was really nice and big with a diving board(my grandson loved going off the diving board). They had entertainment in the afternoon and evenings at the beach bar and grill. Oh! they had waitress service at the beach and the pool and they would bring your food and drinks right to you(nice touch). We had a good time at this hotel and we would stay here again(wish we could have stayed longer it just goes to fast!)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful last-minute overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: xpuctr
Reviews.Content: When trying to plan a last-minute (weeknight) overnight stay in Ocean City, I scoured review after review for open hotels and motels up and down the beach. I was growing anxious after reading the many mixed reviews ranging from mold jumping into bed with you at night to rooms that were clean, but cost an arm and a leg. After reading conflicting reviews of various hotels for a few hours, I wasn't sure this overnight stay was worth the stress it was causing. Thankfully, this overnight stay in the Waverly Castle (5th floor, ocean facing), was nothing short of wonderful. Check-in was a breeze, our room was neat and clean, and the amenities were plentiful for what we needed (soap, shampoo, fridge, microwave, drying rack). This unit also had a little kitchenette that was a pleasant surprise. A hearty thank you to all the TripAdvisor reviewers who helped me choose this location (and who inspired my first-ever review). We did learn that there are three buildings that are part of this complex. All three are wonderfully near the beach (a short walk through the sand dunes), but they also have different proximity to other amenities. One is near the pool, another near the restaurant and bar, Coconuts, and the third a little more away from the aforementioned (Waverly Castle). As two adults who were enjoying a last-minute romantic getaway, our building was perfect (away from kids at the pool and guests enjoying food and drink at Coconuts). The view was amazing, the staff was exceptional with check-in / check-out and general help (they turned us onto the Beach Bus to get to the boardwalk [$1/way per person]), and the room was not only "not scary," but very clean and allowed us to relax and enjoy our mini-vacation. The short of the long: we wanted a basic hotel that was clean, close to the beach, and would not require us to give up a life or limb. Castle in the Sand (Waverly Castle specifically) met our needs and allowed us to enjoy our getaway. We look forward to returning (to our same room if possible!).

Reviews.Title: “Castle was more medieval than previous reviews.”
Reviews.Author: suzieboop
Reviews.Content: Researched a lot of hotels that had beach access and Castle in the Sand had good reviews, decent price and not right on boardwalk. But we thought the building we were in was very outdated. Our room was clean and being on the 3rd floor was high enough to be above the sand dunes with a nice ocean view. The restaurant for breakfast was in the basement of another building where housekeeping staff was coming and going. I also thought the $10 key deposit for real room keys was ridiculous. Maybe they should consider updating to key cards instead. And I also overheard in lobby that someone in a "suite" had a charge of $15 for use of a microwave that she wasn't aware of so beware of hidden charges.

Reviews.Title: “Internet issues, outdated bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: jett456
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel always tries to accomodate when things are not up to par. The internet issue needs to be addressed. I had a terrible time connecting in our room in Castle North. I complained numerous times and each time someone would try to fix it. It would work for awhile and then nothing. I had better luck with a public wifi on the beach. Other than that, the mold on the porch was cleaned ASAP. There were new kitchen cabinets, counter and new sofa. Bathroom is still old and outdated but at least it was clean. I had family in the cottages and it is so old and outdated. The shower doors where pretty disgusting but someone came right away and cleaned them. Coconuts is still the best thing about this hotel. And the beach!!! We have friends that stay elsewhere now come to 38th street to use the beach and bar. We pay the price that we do because of the beautiful view but the hotel should be updated more regularly.

Reviews.Title: “The Bates Motel- worst trip ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela F
Reviews.Content: I went to OC last week with a friend and children. We stayed in 205. There were ants in the kitchen and all over the sink. There was spider webs in the bathroom. They sheets had female stains. The furniture was old, outdated and smelly. My friend fell down the stairs because they (stairs) were too short... my foot couldn't even fit perfectly on them. The closet door in the upper bedroom was off the hinges.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryan B
Reviews.Content: I have a family beach house but when its crowded I always stay at the castle, typically for a long weekend. I like their cabins, you get all the amenities of the hotel but the privacy of a house. The location is perfect for everything you could want to do in OC. The pool has the only diving board left in Ocean City. Its the only strip of beach that you can enjoy a drink. The outdoor restaurant has great food at a good price and the best happy hour in town (2 for 1 drinks) The happy hour gets more popular every weekend. The staff is friendly and hard working. Nothing else in Ocean City compares to the Castle, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT WEEK.. GREAT ACCOMADATION...”
Reviews.Author: jyatt23
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Castle in the Sand for the week of the 4th (1st-8th) with myself and 4-5 friends, all of whom just turned 21 this year, and I honestly couldn't even think of one negative thing to say about this place. From the time I called and reserved our room in January til the moment we checked out their service was absolutely impeccable. Every single employee I dealt with was helpful and friendly (waitresses, bartenders, front desk, housekeeping). We stayed in one of the cottages located immediately to the west of the pool and although it seemed small, we had no trouble sleeping/accommadating 5-6 the entire vacation. The happy hour was poppin' every day and got a little over crowded around the bar area but it wasn't anything I wasn't expecting considering the 2for1 special on anything you want to drink. This place is ideal for the younger crowd but, from what I saw, it seemed like a great spot for families too. We ate lunch twice right at Coconuts and, like I said before, our waitress was very friendly and likeable as were the bartenders that were there all week. I want to give a special shout out to the beach service girls because they have a tough job to say the least and the scorching temps we had all week didn't make their job any easier. When I come back to OCMD, Castle in the Sand will be one of the first places I look at when figuring out where to stay. BRAVO to the castle in the sand ownership and staff.. PS we already got our security deposit of $300 back

Reviews.Title: “One visit - Two different rooms”
Reviews.Author: Evalynn1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the fourth of July week and because we had a tremendous time in Ocen City, we extended by a day ths two different rooms. The htel GRACIOUSLY took care of moving all of our stuff. Staff was fabulous! Bach was great! Coconuts was amazing! First room in main building, second floor was older. I thought their website said this building was renovated this year but it could not have been. It was very small and outdated. We just thought f it as a "beach motel" type of room. My main issue was the A/C. It was in the living room but the bedroom did not get ANY A/C. Bths was an issue for July. HOT. We took care of it by buying two fans at Walmart so we could sleep. This room is supposed to fit four - but was very crowded. Second room for our extended stay was in the building to the south - The Waverly building. Now this room was Huge and the A/C worked amazingly well. Can we say FREEZING which was perfect for 100 degree temperatures. Again - hotel staff, pool, beach drink service ALL amazing........main building was a let down!

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: Even though this is only our second time staying with Castle in the Sand, we have again found our stay to be very enjoyable! No need to look elsewhere for a great vacation...this place has it all! Great food & drinks, private beach with a great beachside wait staff and daily and nightly live music, volley ball court, pool and much more. K-Coast Surf Shop is directly across the street and is a favorite for clothing, boogie boards etc. We brought our bikes and rode each day a short 10 blocks to the boardwalk. The Fractured Prune is only several blocks away and is one of our new favorites for donuts and coffee. Our children range from high school age to college age and when asked where they would like to stay in Ocean City, Md, they overwhelmingly chose Castle in the Sand!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Ocean City Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ambrosekathym
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Waverly Efficiencies on the third floor with an ocean View. It was a great little room with a mini kitchenette, which was in great shape. We loved being able to see and hear the ocean from the balcony. The kids loved the pool and diving board and my girls were able to swim laps early in the morning. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: renee h
Reviews.Content: me and my family have been coming here for 4 yrs and we wouldnt go anywhere else...we stay on first floor so the kids can play in the sand right outside the room until its beach time! coconuts is great with their live bands and wonderful happy hour and the kids movie nite is my sons highlight of the week! all the staff is wonderful too!!! highly reccomended! see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite in OC”
Reviews.Author: fredblen
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here for a week three of the last four years and we look forward to next year. With the awesome Coconuts beach bar and grill, the redone rooms and great character of this not-so-new hotel, you will likely return as we have. We stayed here in 09, moved to the five star expensive Hilton in 10, then back here in 11 and 12. The Hilton is definitely nice but we will choose Castle from now on. When we first arrived here in 09 our first impression was not so good. After a day or two we were like hey this place is pretty cool, and by the end of the week we loved it. You really have to try it to know what I mean. With the excellent bands, food, great views, nice people and all around just great place to be, we always wish for a longer stay. Thanks Castle for the great job you do. Don't ever change!

Reviews.Title: “Castle In the Sand...greatest place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: King0ftheCastle
Reviews.Content: Can it get any better on a vacation in OCMD?! This hotel has everything you possibly need or would want in vacation, whether you are single, a couple, or a family. Rooms are clean and quiet, amazing views from balcony windows, and you cant beat the location. At 37th street you are close to everything within Ocean City. Castle offers the best happy hour in town from 5-6 pm, there is live music, drinks available at your service on the beach, and comfortable lounge chairs to relax and catch some sun or watch competitive beach volleyball games on their private court. You can sit down and enjoy lunch which we did each day. Jerk chicken wrap is a personal favorite to go along with some fresh squeezed orange crushes. Can't wait to get back down again this summer! A+!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Spacious Hotel with Awesome Children's Entertainment”
Reviews.Author: SYRTravel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Castle in the Sand for four nights. Our room was clean and very spacious. We especially loved the direct access to the beach from our first floor Northside room. My only complaint was the very large water stain in the bathroom ceiling tile, which should have been replaced. The highlight of our stay was the daily children's' entertainment by Lady Sunshine! We have a 4 year old and a 2 year old, who both had a blast with all of the activities she had planned each day. We will definitely consider returning for a stay next summer just to see Lady Sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand stay”
Reviews.Author: courtney214
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Castle in the Sand way back in January because of a wedding we were attending in June. With that, we expected to have first dibs on a nice room. Once we got to the wedding we started talking with other guests. Turns out they stayed in a suite for less price and booked in the same month. We went to the lobby to complain and they only gave us $70 off of our bill. The point was we would have preferred to pay less money and have an oceanfront view with a kitchenette. Instead we paid MORE money and had a parking lot view with no kitchenette. In addition only ONE light worked in our room and by the end of the week we had NO lights working (except the bathroom). Again, nothing was done about this issue. On a positive note, the Coconuts bar and grill was a very nice, convenient place to hang out. However, it closed waaay to early every night. The wedding party and guests would have spent a lot more money at the bar and grill if it stayed open until at least eleven. With that, the food was okay, nothing impressive. To end my review I would like to also make it clear that the maid service was poor. Our beds were made each day, but done very poorly. It was obvious that we didn't even receive clean pillow cases at all while staying there. If I had the choice, I would NOT stay here again. I've been to Ocean City,MD every year for the past ten years and would much rather stay at the other places I've been to. Sorry Castle in the Sand, but service was poor and our stay was not as enjoyable as we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “A Fan of The Hotel With A Few Issues This Year”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl_08Pa
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have being going to Ocean City, MD on a fairly reguar basis for over 26 years so I am no first timer to the area and the resorts. Let me also say that I have stayed at Castle In The Sand a few times and have always been happy there. I will start with the good! We arrived on Thursday morning around 11 knowing that check in wasn't until 3:00. I asked if we could check in early and although our room wasn't ready, the man at the desk said they would call my cell when the room WAS ready and that we were free to get our parking pass and use the pool, bar, changing room, etc. He must have called for immediate maid service as our room was ready in less than 30 minutes which made us very happy! I like to stay in the Waverly building as it is all oceanfront and that is a priority for me. This building I feel is the best as it has all private balconies, nice elevators, and big efficiencies! The cottages do NOT have any type of oceanview at all as they are set along the perimeter of the parking lot so if you are looking for the beachy, ocean feeling you do not want to stay in one of those. The main building is next to the bar and restaurant and the bedrooms are in the back so you have windows on the pool side not facing the ocean. This building does NOT have elevators so keep this in mind when it comes to carrying luggage, children, beach rolling carriers, etc. Also, if you are not a fan of noise, the bar, Coconuts can get pretty loud. The other building does have oceanfront rooms, but no balconies. Coconuts is a big attraction here because they have a "speed" Happy Hour which runs from 5:00-6:00 and serves buy 1 get one free drinks! It is a good time but it DOES get busy as it attracts people from other hotels as well as the locals so I would suggest getting a seat at the bar before 5. I always have fun at this bar but since it does get busy sometimes you find yourself fighting for service and people pushing to get in front of you in line. We got a table at the outside restaurant one of the nights we were there and sat at the table for over 30 minutes and a waitress never came to wait on us so I wouldn't suggest trying to eat during that hour. The waitresses were all running around like crazy so it wasn't a lazy issue, it was just a very CROWDED issue. Now for our problem...the cleaning service!!! The first full day we were there we hadn't yet unpacked and had our valuables scattered everywhere (we were too excited to run to the beach to take the time to unpack properly..and there are no safes in the rooms) We chose to NOT have the room cleaned since we hadn't really dirtied anything yet and did not have the room in cleaning condition with our stuff everywhere. So we put the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door and went to the beach. When we got back to the room the sign was on the other side of the door and the room had been cleaned! My boyfriend saw the person responsible for cleaning our room out in the hall and confronted him as to why he entered and cleaned the room when we specifically put the sign on the door that we didn't want that done. The reason given was that the manager of the hotel TOLD him to enter the rooms regardless of the sign as many people put it there by accident. We were told that he entered the room because he had knocked and we didn't answer the door.Ummm...come on people, we all know guests have different reasons for putting that sign on the door and that he shouldn't have even KNOCKED let alone keyed into the room! He then told us that we would have to let him know in the morning a "yes" or "no" regarding getting our room cleaned so we asked WHY we had to personally TELL him as that is the point of the "Maid Service Please" vs "Do Not Disturb" sign. He said "no" as the manager says he has to key in regardless of the sign. Well...we weren't understanding this so we went to talk to the front desk where we were told that this was not true and that they would talk to him. Well...from then on we never had a clean room! We would put the "Maid Service Please" sign on the door and would get our bed made (sheets not changed) and new towels...nothing else. The bathroom was not cleaned once, the floors were not cleaned, and not even the countertops wiped down! A contact solution bottle bounced out of our garbage can on day 2 and as a "test" I left it there. By day 6 it was still there along with the sand and everyday "grime" in the shower, sinks, toilet, floors, etc. I know that hotels try to conserve water and I don't know how often they are supposed to change the sheets but I have NEVER EVER been in a hotel that didn't clean the bathrooms and wipe down counters. We had to eventually ask the cleaning service man to change our sheets because they were sandy and looking a bit rough. Everyone knows what rooms can get like on a beach trip...even for the cleanest of people! I did hear a number of people complaining about the location of the bathrooms for the beach and bar as you literally have to walk through the inside restaurant and wear shoes and a shirt to use them. We were even approached for just glancing at the breakfast buffet before going to the beach in the AM because my boyfriend didn't have a shirt on. We didn't see the sign about the shirt when walking in so we immediately explained that we just wanted to look to see what was on it, not sit down and eat. It only took 2 seconds before another staff member said "PLEASE" so they are very strict about that. Be prepared to re-dress if you need to use the restaurant while on the beach. We didn't find this to be an issue as we just used our own room. So you have to walk a little bit..who cares? All in all I really like this hotel. It is not super fancy but it's in a great location with bar and food service on the beach along with reasonable prices, and great ocean views! If anyone has any questions please feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Coconuts!”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Castle in the Sand with a few buddies Memorial Day Weekend. We are all in our 20's. It was a great hotel for us. We stayed on a second floor suite in Castle North. The room was a large open rectangular space that had two double beds, a full kitchen and a living room area with a couch, two lounge chairs and a flat screen. I'd guess in total it was about 500 square feet. It also had a nice balcony facing the ocean. The room was in good condition, clean and free of pests. My only criticism of the hotel is the condensate line on the A/C unit directly above us must have been broken because condensation dripped on our balcony throughout the trip, not really that big of a deal to us. The hotel has a great bar called Coconuts. The bar is outside and was busy all day. There is live music most of the day as well. From 5pm-6pm the happy hour is 2 for 1 drinks and the bar was packed during this time every day. It was mostly young people, 20's and 30's. If you buy a drink at the bar you are allowed to bring it on the beach. The wait staff will also bring you drinks on the beach. We are cheap, so we took our own beer in thermoses, but it was a nice service nonetheless. The hotel also has a large swimming pool and a nice diving board. Obviously, we started a cannon ball contest. There is also a beach volleyball area which was always in use. Located on 37th street, the hotel was central everything, i.e. bars. Seacrets, Fager's and Macky's are all an easy walk. Overall, this is a great hotel for people in their 20's and 30's who are in OC to party. I would not recommend this hotel for families with kids as drunk party goers come back from the bars and are loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jacob E
Reviews.Content: I stayed in what is affectionately referred to by the hotel employees as the Foltin suite because of a guest that's been staying in this room for 20+ yrs. and its easy to see why anyone would want to keep coming back. Upon check in I was warmly greeted by the front desk staff (shout out to andrei, jack, and sue ann!). Those guys really know there stuff and were far beyond helpful. Once i got to my room the first thing i noticed was how incredibly clean the room was (shout out to Ebony!). I got unpacked and headed out to the highly recommended Coconuts beach bar and grill that was conveniently located about 50 steps from my room (I counted one night). I sat at the bar and had a Queen Anne slam with a Meyers floater. Chloe told me to try it and it was the best suggestion I've ever taken. I think the bartender Pam had something to do with them being so good too! Another big shout out to Brandie and Jess at the grill. I ate lunch there for all 3 of the days i was there and nothing I had was short of delicious. This truly was the all around best trip I've ever taken and will most definitely be scheduling my return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Diamond H
Reviews.Content: I had the most amazing time at this hotel! I found that the customer service was well above average. The staff was always ready to lend a helping hand in any way they could. My friends and I had a horrible experience and searched for hours for a hotel that we could manage to pay for, and when we came upon THIS hotel, we knew we had to take the opportunity! YOU WANT TO STAY HERE. It's clean, right by the beach, the boardwalk, and literally everything you need is either walking distance or a 5minute car ride away.

Reviews.Title: “1982 - Your room is ready.”
Reviews.Author: Graham G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night this past weekend. It was like entering a time machine. This place has not been updated or cleaned in over two decades. Just because you put a piece of granite in the kitchen does not make it new. You just can't overlook the ancient bedspreads, worn out carpet, mismatached tiles and filthy balcony. This place is perfect for broke teenagers which it was full of when I was there. On a positive note the view from the room was very nice. The question is are you willing to walk through the dirt to see it? If you like dumps you'll love this place. Enjoy the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cody447
Reviews.Content: Once again, a big "THANK YOU" to the owners, management and staff for another great stay! Loved the improvements you've made to the Cottage #12 units!! See you again next year (maybe sooner)!!!!! A suggestion, if I may: a GFI outlet in the wall of the bathroom would be great! Can't fit the plug of the hairdryer into the socket on the light (not enough room)!

Reviews.Title: “REFURBISHED/ ON BEACH/ SUPER COMFORTABLE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KEM9125
Reviews.Content: Stayed at "Castle in the Sand" last weekend in April for the past nine years! Thurs. thru Mon. for the WARD WATERFOWL CARVING CHAMPIONSHIPS held in the Convention Center almost across the street. Our room in the North building had just been totally refurbished and as usual was spic and span. Love the spaciousness of unit split into living rm, kitchen & bath, & bedroom. I'm a poor sleeper and could read or watch T.V. in Living Room while my son slept. Rectangular arrangement of unit allows breeze off ocean to flow thru unit unless louvered windows are shut. I love the air! Beds were terrific, chairs had spring and the shower water was hot! Kitchen had appliances, utensils, etc. for full meals. We ate out. Staff treated us like family. Suggestions on Where to Eat have always been Right On. Have always made reservations for following year before leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location......Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sonja M
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed when I visited Castle in the Sand during the off season. It was the perfect opportunity to check things out, while prices are lower and the crowds are smaller. The staff was great and my accomodations were surprisingly spacious with a perfect ocean view from my private second floor balcony. I was also very happy with the outside entrance and super easy access to the beach. There is nothing better than once your there to have nothing but soft white sand between your room and the water. There are so many places to eat and shop in OC. Perfect for singles and families.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel retains ocean-side charm”
Reviews.Author: Emilia K
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for an off-season weekend. Older hotel, but nice-sized, clean rooms. Stayed in penthouse (top floor of 5) room overlooking ocean. Just beautiful. AC was a bit loud, but beds were sooooo comfy, slept like a baby! Very nice breakfast buffet at a reasonable price. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: oceancityfans
Reviews.Content: My favorite place in OC. Love Coconuts and all the staff. Smiles begin at the office all the way through to the maintenance department. Housekkeeping is so sweet and always ready for a smile. Greatest bar staff on the beach. Love you all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff - Will be booking again”
Reviews.Author: nomoboro
Reviews.Content: After having a not so nice experience at a hotel across town (see my other reviews) we made reservations with Castle in the Sand. While they don't allow pets in their hotel, the do in their cottages. The cottages are rustic, but immaculate. The furniture was new and our two day stay with our dogs was excellent. The cottages are on the property of the hotel, and about 100 yard walk to the beach. Being off-season, dogs were allowed and it was a short walk to a perfect spot. The staff was friendly, both when booking and when checking out two days later. They also remembered which was a nice touch. We've stayed at their sister property, The Barefoot Mailman (which does allow pets), but they were sold out this weekend. It was a last mintute reservation, as the hotel that we booked refused our reservation, despite listing "Pets Accepted" on their website.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL STAY EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Ebenezer A
Reviews.Content: When me and my friend went on vacation in Ocean City, we went to a place that false advertised and was a complete wreck. We found in hard to find a affordable decent place to stay and were about to pack our bags and go home. HOWEVER! CASTLE IN THE SAND SAVED THE DAY. When we first got there the Receptionist at the front desk were extremely hospitable and a pleasure to be around they made our trip into a paradise. Not to mention the ROOMS! Amazing view of the ocean super super super clean in every aspect of the world. Never had to ask for new towels. Every time we left our rooms and came back our beds were made and new towels put it. If your in Ocean City and you need a place Castle In The Sand is the best place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Get the "Royal Treatment"”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the castle since it opened many years ago. Finally made a reservation for March 30. Check in/out was easy and quick. Staff was extremely friendly and courteous. Room was very clean and decent sized. Cons were bathroom was very small and there was no balcony for our room. But we had a beautiful view of the main drag, convention center, and the bay. Conveniently located to attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MAKES YOU FEEL AS IF YOU ARE A KING AND QUEEN, STAYING IN YOUR OWN CASTLE”
Reviews.Author: GOLFER117
Reviews.Content: we stayed at castle in the sand three nights from march 30, 2012 to april 2, 2012, great place we alway check with the trip advisor site before we book any hotels we plan to go to, excellent reviews, the place was within walking distance of the ocean city convention centre, our grand daughter was performing in the cheerleading contest there, the room 413 was excellent the staff was polite and professional, robert, sue ann, john, jack, matt, lucind, wayne,candy, andie, young jack, if i misspelled anyone's name please forgive, the castle made my wife and i feel like king and queen in one's castle, many thanks from janet and robert molter of holbrook, new york

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydogDallastown
Reviews.Content: let start off with the pros of this room it was oceanfront so the view was top notch 2. there was a clog in tub drain and they were pretty quick to fix it. 3. the room was very clean. and thats about all for the pros. ok now the cons lets start with the beds lets just say you my as well sleep on a slab of concrete(arent beds in hotels supposed to be soft?)and the pillows dont have nothing to them u need like all 4 to equal 1 regular pillow. the balcony was nice to have but WAY TO SMALL, my girl would have to put her feet up every time i walked by and i still stubbed my stinking toe on railing the chairs outside were horrbily uncomfortable max 3 feet from wall to balcony oh and my girl is only 4 11 maybe it was just our room 5004 in waverly castle but i highly doubt it will not stay here again quality inn on 33rd was sooo much better and it was only 20 dollars more a night. oh and if your going there just for coconuts bar u dont have to stay there cause u can go there from any hotel i asked

Reviews.Title: “St Paddys at Castle in the Sand”
Reviews.Author: flyinburrito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castle in the Sand during St Paddys weekend 2012. Check in and check out was smooth. The front desk was very nice and helpful. We stayed in the Oceanfront Penthouse, which had an awesome view of the beach and ocean. In the summer it would be a perfect view. The hotel is in walking distance to the 28th street area and the 45st village which is the ending point for the St Paddys parade. Can’t wait for coconuts to open in early May. Price, location, all in all it was a good choice and we we’re happy with our choice and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Macilly
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that could use some updating. We stayed in the north building and our room was ok. It does NOT have central air. Again - we did NOT have central air and the A/C unit was located in the living room area by the balcony. That meant our back bedroom got uncomfortably warm. I actually just went and slept on the couch because it was just too hot in the bedroom to sleep. The pool is very large and nice. They check your name when you enter so outsiders can't use the pool. I hate the restaurant located on the patio. I have no idea WHY they ruined that area with the cheesy restaurant because the food is not very good and you get eaten by bugs. They use to have a grill and you could just buy burgers by the bar so I don' t understand the point of the open air restaurant other than to completely ruin the view/atmosphere for the building right behind it. Big dislike on that one especially since they have a restaurant downstairs. The ladies that run the kids activities were very nice and my children liked that alot. They made masks and pirate hats. Very fun for them. The beach was fine. Plenty room to put down your towel and I did see waitresses from hotel roaming around getting drinks for folks. Nice touch. Overall - it was ok. Not sure we will bother going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in ocean city!”
Reviews.Author: yogidavis24
Reviews.Content: This is a privately owned resort, therefore it is the only resort in ocean city that has a private beach. We love lounging by the ocean and having waitress service! You can order delicious cocktails or food from their outdoor grill and have it delivered to your beach chair. We have stayed in the north suites and the south suites. Both have kitchens and family rooms. It's always been clean and perfect. There are townhouses you can rent also. The nice thing about this hotel is that it is not a huge high rise with thousands of guest. It's in between so there isn't herds of people trampling over you. It's closer to the boardwalk than most of the hotels this what we like. You can walk to a nearby bus stop and take the bus which goes up and down the strip all day long for a buck. They have a great tiki lounge which is open day and night, an inside bar where you can play keno. Take out breakfast place. Place your order over the phone walk two min to pick it up. The swimming pool is in the front which is great so the screaming children are away from the tiki bar which is near the sand. No reason not to stay here and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a bachelorette party in September of 2011. There were about 12 girls and we rented three rooms. The rooms were spacious and all three of ours were identical which was great. There was a door to the outside that had chairs that were right on sand and the beach was steps away. Sadly it rained the entire weekend, so we didn't get to enjoy the beach, but it would have been great. The rooms have kitchen areas which is great for storing food, snacks and drinks. There were seperate tables and a couch. It was really a great space. The staff was pretty helpful as as well. There is an outdoor restaurant/bar area which was fun during the day. Even in the rain they were open. A pretty good band was playing cover tunes we could all sing along to. The food was affordable and tasty. There were really great drinks also and during happy hour they are buy one get one. Try the creamisicle one!! The only negatives were that there seem to be a lot of people that hang out in the parking lot and drink which is odd. Also, after the clubs close you can't hang outside your room. We did and were told by staff that we were loud and cops would come. That is a bit of a bummer if the weather was nice. The decor is a bit outdated but not run down by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Gross unless you are ok with "BAG WORMS" EWWWWWWWWW”
Reviews.Author: eloci63
Reviews.Content: First of all, anything and everything you do is being watched at every moment by the owner that lives next door. I can live with that as we are good and respectful tenants. The wost part of this property is bag worms. You heard me, bag worms. Google them. They are everywhere. They are disgusting and ruined our vacation. I had my brother in law go remove them and they all returned the next day. Soooo icky. I would never stay here again until they correct this issue. Seriously, google bag worms before you stay here. They are infesting this property and it is disgusting. Never staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A-1 PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Superbird540
Reviews.Content: Went there for the Ocean City endless summer car cruise and it was great_ nice place, good location- very helpful staff and plenty of parking for trailers and cars. We went a week after the beach bar and restaurant closed but i can tell it's a happening place in the summer- look forward to booking during the summertime! Clean rooms, great beach, good food at their buffet ( ya gotta try the breakfast) and very pleased for the price, which was half of another local hotel which i love too.....They were all booked so I went to the Castle and had a great experience. Beds were nice and comfy and had plenty of pillows and i slept well. Stayed on the 4th floor- great view and in the North Tower- Thanks Castle! i'll be back in May for the car show again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tami2shoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in Oct. 2011. Good central location, and the beach was in great shape. We stayed in the Waverly Tower with the ocean views. The room was suprising spacious. The mini kitchen was adequate for breakfast and lunch. The place was clean but dated. There were 4 pillows on each bed. Parking was good and the off season rate was a deal. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money....................”
Reviews.Author: jimiwaz
Reviews.Content: Fifty members of our club (seniors who hike, bike 30-40 miles per day and kayak) stayed here for a week in Oct. All our rooms in the Wakley Tower had ocean views. The place is dated but was spacious and clean.Kitchen utensils were more than adequate. Plus being off season we got a fantastic price for the week and the location couldn't be better. I would recommend it highly..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: mrsdeg63
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Castle in the Sand for the last 8 years. We love the place so much. My only complaint is this past summer when it was happy hour at Coconuts the outside bar and it was almost impossible to get off the beach through the mounds of people at the outside bar. We were knocking into people who where stacked 5 deep on the beach path, drinks in hand and my kids couldn't get through with their beach stuff. I felt like we were walking through the middle of a nightclub with my kids and it was awful. Other than that, the place is great. Rooms clean, service excellent and location is super!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for ALL!”
Reviews.Author: trixienj_laraman
Reviews.Content: Castle in the Sand Hotel offers so much - all at your fingertips: Walk right onto the beach from your room, drink & food service offered on their beach, 'CastleInTheSand' lifeguards stationed at their beach, umbrella & chair rentals, Olympic-size pool, Coconuts restaurant open all afternoon & night along with a live band, game room, elevator in the North Tower, and Miss Sunshine & Lady J entertaining kids of all ages. Another plus is that the staff are very accommodating & very pleasant. On the down side, the rooms need to be updated. Every year we come, there are a few new updates to the room but it is not enough. I overlook this aspect because of everything else that the Castle offers. My family of 4 would never think about going anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneS1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wavery Castle bayside and loved the room. It was clean and spacious with a small kitchen area. The beds were comfortable and the maid service was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were a bit nervous about the room because of negative reviews we read, but could not have been happier. I have no idea what people are complaining about. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 complaint”
Reviews.Author: Pogo5816
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying here and I will be back. My only complaint is that the ceiling fan is going in the wrong direction and there is no switch to change it manually. Therefore, the room is a little warmer than I like, but it is ok. That's my only complaint. Everything else is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “good location but hotel is basic”
Reviews.Author: jenifer22
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic and bathroom felt dirty but the location right on the beach was great and the pool was nice to jump in after spending the day at the beach. Outdoor dining was fun but the food was similar to the room...basic. Don't expect much, have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: On our most recent trip to Ocean City Maryland I really looked forward to our stay at Castle in the Sand. We arrived later than expected around 10PM and had no issue with check in. Our room was located in the recently renovated North building. The room was decorated brightly and equipped with a flat screen TV. The bathroom was tiny. I could barely fit in to shut the door. I called down to the front desk for some extra towels and was instructed to walk back to check in for the extra towels which I did. So much for customer friendly care. My family unpacked and went to bed. The next morning I jumped in the shower only to find limited hot water. The hot water problem lasted our whole stay. Another issue we had was with the towels, many of them appeared stained with black dots. It got gross after a while. Staying with the theme of lazy and dirty the maid service was horrible. Our toilet paper roll was empty on day one and the maid staff was so lazy they never put a new roll on the holder all week. The simple put a new roll on the sink counter. Another issue was the mini refrigerator. It smelled like dead fish. The maid tried to clean it but had no success. The final straw of this overpriced and under serviced hotel was the elevator. The elevator was broken three of the five days we were there. I have stayed at several other hotels in the same price range some were even less that were a better value. Enter with caution on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: MMOBNJ
Reviews.Content: the hotel was outdated and could use a tune-up of sorts. We were in the Oceanfront 1 bedroom suite. The room is oddly set up. You enter the suite right into the main bedroom which you have to pass through to get to the living room/kitchen area. There is also no AC and no TV in the bedroom, so by the second night, we had to purchase a small fan for some relief. The bed was very uncomfortable as was the fold out bed in the living room. Once you opened the bed, it took up the entire room. Everything in the room was old and pitted-the light fixtures, vents, switch plates, etc.-though it was clean. There was a small HDTV in the living room, but it wasn't an HD signal, so the picture quality was shoddy. They also claim free Wi-Fi, but the signal was extremely weak, so using a cell phone or laptop was nearly impossible unless you were outside. The water pressure was very weak, so showering after a day of sun, pool, and beach was not very pleasant. We did like the balcony, which is a comfortable area for 2 with a great view. The employees were friendly and helpful and the location was great, but we may look into other options for our next trip to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: KatOB327
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Castle in the Sand for the Surfers Healing event held on their own private beach. The staff was very friendly and accomadated us with everything that we needed for this event, which is not an easy task when you have 170 families with autism around! Patrica and Bob two of the best of any hotel staff I have met! I love Castle in the Sand as they help support the autism community by letting special needs camp take place on their private beach. The Castle in the sand is clean and convieniently located, as it is right down the road from Seacrets and Fagger's Island (two local "hot spots")

Reviews.Title: “I still love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kurlygirl
Reviews.Content: Regardless of the bad reviews from some folks, our family has been staying at the Castle for about the last 5 years. We always try to reserve the apartment -like suites since we normally have 3 to 4 people with us. If you want an ocean view, ask for a 2nd or 3rd floor room. The 1st floor suites open to a patio behind the dunes with no beach view, the 2nd floor has a view of the top of the dunes and beach, but the 3rd floor is the best view! And if you happen to be placed in a 1st floor suite, try asking the office to move you to an available room higher up, they are always happy to help. They also have efficiency suites available that sleep the same number of people in one room with a small kitchenette that we have stayed in. Yes, the hotel is older, but last year all of the mattresses were replaced and this year the pots, pans and cooking utensils were all replaced with brand new items. Our experience with the maids, servers and office workers has always been wonderful. Yes, some of the staff don't speak or understand English well...they're mainly from Eastern European countries but have always been very nice to us. One reviewer mentioned that there were no lifeguards on the beach....the lifeguards come out at 10:00 am and leave at around 5:00 or 6:00 pm everyday. I'm not sure just where that reviewer was, but we stayed here during the same time period and set up just behind the lifeguard stand because we had children with us and that stand was ALWAYS manned. And we enjoy renting the umbrellas on the beach because that's less stuff for us to drag out every morning. We love the Castle because it's very family friendly and convenient for us. The hotel shows a family oriented movie on the outside of the building every Tuesday night and even though our kids are a little too old for the theme of the move, we still enjoy sitting under the stars and watching the film.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need Is Here -”
Reviews.Author: EllenTBO
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Castle for years, and I still enjoy my time at the Castle. I stayed in one of the suites this year, and there was plenty of room. The air conditioner worked, the bathroom was clean, my carpet was clean, my fridge was clean, I received plenty of towels, and the staff could not have been nicer. It's a delight when the bar servers come down to the beach and serve you food/drinks as you are relaxing. And it's great not having to drag my chairs and umbrella to the beach - I just rent them for dollars a day! And if you have any questions about how rough the ocean is, just ask the life guards, on duty from early morning to later afternoon! And if you are at the hotel pool, there is a bathroom right there for your convenience. Or can can go downstairs where there there is another public bathroom. And when check-in and park your car, there really is no need to leave the hotel grounds - restaurant downstairs, outdoor bar and grill. You can get carryout breakfast from the restaurant that is very good. And the outdoor grill has delicious food. I am looking forward to staying at the Castle again next year!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!! Awful and Overpriced,”
Reviews.Author: jlofrench
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that we trusted some of the good reviews that came out of this site....but if you are reading this review PLEASE!!!!! Beware that the place looks and sounds better in paper than it is. Even though we got a room in the North tower 5th floor/no balcony for $300/night it was awful: no toilet paper, toilet overflowed, smelled, AC sounded like race car motor, TV barely worked. Because the hotel is so old it doesn't have a service elevator which means you will have to share the elevator with the laundry, cleaning, food etc people, who by the way were rude and had no consideration for the guests . There is also no AC so you will sophocate for a bit. The restaurant downstairs is outdated and the service did not speak any english. Actually noone spoke english, so if you had a question you are on your own. The pool was not confortable as it was about 50 degrees! FYI, if you are a family with children...do NOT stay here!!! The roudy/drunk crowd starts gathering in the outside patio restaurant around 12p and it goes on til the night time. There is no store to buy amenities so make sure you come loaded! Because $300 is not enough money. You will also have to pay to get umbrellas and beach chairs at the beach. No lifeguards! Overall...don't stay at this place. Go to Hilton, Holiday INn. t

Reviews.Title: “Drugs Found in the room”
Reviews.Author: elsa3732
Reviews.Content: This place is an over priced dump. The first night a small bag of white powder fell out of a folded towel. Had to file a police report and was uncomfortable about who might be looking for their dope the rest of the week. Place wreaked of smoke, bed was broken, and got shorted towels the next night. Although we didn't find any more drugs in the towels. Shop around you can definitely do better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room But Could Not Sleep”
Reviews.Author: lbidetti
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice oceanfront room, lovely balcony to sit on, clean BUT a hugh ice machine was across the hall that made ice all night. People didn't just fill the ice buckets, they filled coolers. Sometimes at 6:00 in the morning! I did go to the office and complained and the clerk apologized. After spending so much $$$ that wasn't good enough. I will be sending them a letter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic entertainment for the family with children provided by Sunshine the Clown”
Reviews.Author: mecak1030
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here for 30+ years. We have taken many precious memories back with us including those of Sunshine the Clown. She entertains the children with beach related activities of face painting, pirate day, stories. Most of all the love she gives to all. Seeing our children so happy with all the fun and excitement she provides all for a cost of a smile, really touches our hearts. Her entertainment goes beyond the 2-6 time slot. She loans out kits for the kids to play with in the eves like juggling, bracelet making, manicure pkg, balloon making, face painting that she freely teaches her skills. She is a memorable part of this hotel. Would not be the same without her.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back!”
Reviews.Author: rmk_9999
