Reviews.Content: Overall, very outdated and not worth the money. We had an "ocean view" (dunes view) 1st storey suite. Very disappointing. The sand as you walked out might as well have been an ash tray. The beach was also very dirty. During our stay, I don't think our room was properly vacuumed even once. We were always the ones sweeping out the little bit of sand. Room service constituted of new towels and our beds being thrown back together - nothing more. This hotel needs to have some money invested into it to bring it up to snuff. Otherwise, friendly staff. Overall, for the $2000+ dollars we paid for the week long stay, it definitely wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VNT143
Reviews.Content: A few couples and I go to the Castle (as we like to call it) every year. It is a very cute hotel located right on the beach. We love the fact that this hotel serves drinks on the beach. However, you are not allowed to bring your own drinks so keep that in mind. They must be purchased at Coconuts which is a bit silly in my opinion. Their hotel restaurant located downstairs (Coconuts) plays live music which is great. The hotel also has a nice, large pool outside. The hotel is also right next to the bus stop if anyone wants to go to the store or a night out at Secrets. It really only takes about 10 minutes to bus to Secrets.. the bus ride can actually be fun. However, if you are looking to stay walking distance to Secrets you may not want to come here? The only complaint I have is that the breakfast/dinner buffet gets a bit dirty.. but the food is good. It is always very crowded. As for the room, nothing spectacular however the oceanside suites have a great view of the ocean and are very spacious. You can easily fit a family or group of 6. The rooms come with a nice kitchen area and living room area. Overall, a very nice family or couple place to stay! I am looking forward to going to the Castle this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room At OC, Md”
Reviews.Author: BillC49
Reviews.Content: Needed to travel here to attend a wedding. After reading some of the reviews on this hotel I had pretty much decided not to stay here. However I came across one very positive review which said the penthouse rooms in the North building had just been remodeled for this year. I did rent one of these rooms on the ocean side. Room was great, appeared to have been just remodeled, very clean, and perfect view. Mini frig, micro wave, coffee maker, flat screen TV. Very nice outside bar, very friendly employees everywhere. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant which was also very good. I cannot speak for any other hotel rooms except for the North Penthouse rooms which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week. What a fun place.”
Reviews.Author: bizyb20
Reviews.Content: Great for the lively crowd. There is entertainment everyday. Short walk to the beach. Rooms were recently renovated and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is friendly. New ice cream bar downstairs is a nice addition. Love the convenience of the Coconuts restaurant, good food, will deliver to beach. This was a fun and easyplace to stay. You could say almost an all in one. There is a breakfast buffet for the hungry crowd or you can order ala carte. Room has a small mini fridge. Good location, Jolly Rogers water park is close and so are some good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty kitchen, very hot, swarming with mosquitoes”
Reviews.Author: judiaustin
Reviews.Content: The kitchen is terribly dirty, the food being served is rancid because the coolers are not at a sufficiently low temperature. The food is only mediocre---if it doesn't make you sick. If you want to be propositioned by members of your sex, you may want to go, but chances are you will get sick from the food.

Reviews.Title: “We Don't recommend this Hotel, We Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: oceancitytrip2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be classified as Motels. Few notes during our stay. 1- A/C is very noisy, it is really very disturbing. 2- A/c was leaking a lot of water on the carpet, almost 1/4 of the room was wet. 3- The toilet was leaking, not holding water in, can't flush when you need it. 4- The bathroom door was not closing, The latch won't work. 5- Don't mention the ceiling light hanging down from the ceiling, Will hit you everytime you pass by. 6- The shower mixer will not work properly, always giving cold water. 7- When check-in, the hotel will hold a cash deposit of $10.00 for the room key. It looks like a lot of customer through the key away as a sort of expressing their anger when checking out. 8- The bathroom is very tight and the toilet is the type for kids, and not adults. 9- The blinds are very old and hardly blocking the light, so expect to wake up so early. 10- The hotel will charge your credit card a portion upon booking, and will deduct the whole amount upon arrival, no refunds will be for early departure, as guests will always complain and try to cancel their reservations. 11- The wireless internet is terrible, hardly working and when working, it is very slow. Never to mention , every time we get up and down the elevator, the plumber will always be there, with his rubber plunge dripping water on the floor. By the way, this hotel doesn't have any public restrooms. If by chance you need to use a restroom while on the beach , you need to go to your room?????? The hotel room was about$190.0 / night, it doesn't worth this money. Definitely, they need to improve their service drastically when charging such a money.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms from 1970”
Reviews.Author: kkline82
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel last yr. First off, the rooms are from tge 70s. Outdated furniture, wallpaper coming off the wall, crappy kitchen tiles, very uncomfortable beds, and smelled like they tried to cover up the smells in the room with potpourri. Worst of all, just walking across our floor made creeking sounds. So bad that the downstairs vacationers actually complained about us! Sorry we have to walk across the floor to go to the bathroom! The walls are very thin. We could hear people talking outside and to make matters worse, it was senior week. The only thing good about this was they had a decent breakfast and it was close to the beach. Other than that, I would not recommend this hotel for any families planning on having a comfortable vacation. This yr we are planning on staying at the Carousel Hotel which we have stayed at before and was more impressed with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Happy Hour with local muscians”
Reviews.Author: Trisheee
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a facelift inside and out. The rooms are outdated and there are no curtains, instead mini blinds. The bathrooms are very small as well. I only ate in the retaurant for breakfast and would not do that again. However, the staff is pleasant and the happy hour at the bar is one of the best around. There was 2 for 1 drinks, girls handing out shot samples and trinkets. It is a great place to people watch and enjoy a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel; horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mykonos97
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at this hotel when we first visited Ocean City. This was the biggest rip off experience as far as hotels go...We paid $250 night and the room was ancient, basic, non-aesthetic, and had NO CURTAINS. All the light came into the room the next morning thru the cheap blinds waking us up....I don' t recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: ckemp_11
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. I would recommend to anyone!!!! The room was very accommidating and clean. I'm very anal about where I stay and this place was up to par. As far as the staff, they went above and beyond. Thank you so much Castle in the Sand...we WILL be back :)

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: dave0520
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a place to go to get away for our anniversary. a co-worker of my wife gave us several hotels in OC, MD. My wife checked them out & found a last minute deal at Castle in the Sand. What a deal it turned out to be. the hotel was clean, conveniently located and had many perks. the staff was super friendly and accommodating. they have a great bar/restaurant (Coconuts), a superb breakfast buffet, and they are the only beach in OC, MD that offers on the beach alcoholic beverages. the waitresses come out on the beach to take your orders. we had an ocean view (5th floor) and a great time. our daughter and her friends are going here in August and we highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience...”
Reviews.Author: sp3ce
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second summer vacation at OC, MD so we decided to try this hotel. Bad idea. No one told me it was Senior Week and when we got there the first night was all out obnoxiousness and inconsideration of other families by these seniors. The next morning, thank goodness, most of them checked out. On top of that horrible first night was the unbelievable noise level from the live entertainment which pretty much lasted at least until 9pm every night. We also didnt know where our room was going to be, so unfortunately, it was directly over the bar/patio area of Coconuts. Nap time for my small children? Forget it...Sleep time for the kids?? Forget that too, let alone sleep time for myself. I went there to relax and ended up being way more stressed out then when i left home because of it. We decided to leave the night before our actual checkout because it was just way too loud. On top of that, i had forgot a treasured object that belonged to my son, and went back multiple times to retrieve it to no avail. It wasnt until we were on the road for a 3rd time that i called back and made them look in the trash. Whala! Come to find that the houseman had thrown it in the trash!! This hotel has a lost and found, but apparently they do not enforce it. They have no idea the disaster that was averted when i called back to make them look in the trash. The total inconsideration and blatent disregard for any procedures or policies regarding lost items infuriated me. This hotel is definitely NOT a place for families looking to have a quiet and relaxing beach experience. And i agree with some of the other reviews about the out-dated furniture and kitchens/bathrooms. They were horrendous, especially the 1-in thick pull out sofa bed. We will not be staying there or recommending anyone else to stay there for that matter. I only wish i could have gotten a refund for checking out early, but that must be one of their scams as they know that people may be checking out early due to the inadequacy of the place. Good riddance, Castle in the Sand!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MMcKnight
Reviews.Content: The grounds and surrounding area of the hotel are nice...Pool is very nice, CoconutsBar and Grille is a nice place with the live music and sand volleyball court, however the rooms left alot to be desired. Rooms are very cramped in space, balcony was un-usable do to small space and the A/C unit running. While the rooms appeared to be clean, the age of the hotel is showing; upgrades need to be done. Bathroom was very old looking and looked dirty. Stains and spots on wallpaper didn't help matters any. We changed hotels as we just were not comfortable in this one. Could not get any part of our money refunded either when we wanted to check out. Had to pay for the entire stay even though we left early. Will not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: BabyHelen
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Castle's for 26 years and have met the most amazing people that I am still in contact with today. Many of us meet the same time every year and have watched our families grow. I can't image a summer without my Castle's In The Sand family. The staff is wonderful. They truly care for Phil and I and always lend a hand since my husband is handicap. The outdoor patio and music cannot be beat. Food and entertainment always top notch. Office staff which is the first introduction you will have to Castles treat you with a smile and always show you how happy they are that you have visited once again. Made many friends at Castle's and consider many as family. Maintance staff the best, servers, bartenders, life guards (Emily), housekeeping, and more. Hate to leave any one out. See you soon Castles just few more weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Last-Minute Experience”
Reviews.Author: byoung4760
Reviews.Content: My sister and I planned a last-minute memorial weekend trip to Ocean City, Maryland. After searching online, many hotels were booked up. I was able to find one of the last hotel rooms available at Castle in the Sand Hotel. Even though the reviews were very good, we were still leary if they were correct. I can truly say that our trip was extremely enjoyable. We stayed on the first floor in Room # 8 and had direct access to the beach. The room was impeccable and the customer service staff was always courteous and friendly. This was our first time coming to Ocean City and we plan on coming again. And when we do, we definetely want to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great View but..............”
Reviews.Author: nannymarlene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Castle in the Sands. Unfortunately, we stayed in the older building. Let me start by saying that the Castle in the Sands looks much nicer on line than in person. The ocean view is spectacular. The staff was very friendly. However, the suite was not clean and desperately needed to be updated (very outdated furniture). There were colonies of ants in the bathroom and kitchen, mainly around the sink areas. There was mold around the bottom of the bathroom shower door and needs to be replaced immediately. The window sill in the bedroom was filthy. It looked like it had not been cleaned in a very long time. To make matters worse, there was no television in the bedroom. I DEFINITELY WOULD NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE EVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Castle in Ruins”
Reviews.Author: Delaware411
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Castle in the Sand for Memorial weekend. Room had a very noisy air conditioner unit which failed to cool the room and leaked water on the adjacent carpet. Spent three days on the beach right in front of the Castle and was never offered beverage service by the staff. Hostess at their Coconuts restaurant would not provide a rough estimate of wait time for a table. I've been taking my family to the Castle for 20 years, but seems like time to find another oceanfront vacation kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LoieJo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay. This is the second time that we have stayed at Castle in the Sand. We had an ocean view room with a kitchenette. You really don't need any more than that. We highly recommend Castle in the Sand. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Abbie717
Reviews.Content: I booked the room because of a great deal I received on-line, but I'll definitely be back. The room was clean, staff was so friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet was excellent and the Coconuts outside bar was the perfect place to spend an afternoon or evening.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: gymfan76
Reviews.Content: We last stayed here 3 yrs ago about the same time of year (see 5/13/08 review "Better than expected"). We had a suite in the north castle again this time but on the 2nd instead of the 3rd floor. The suite was just as good and clean as before but with upgraded flat screen tvs (can't remember if they were flat before). Only minor negative this time is the heat/air fan noise could bother some people during the night. When checking hotels for this trip, similar suites with a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds, living room area with queen sofa bed and full kitchen facilities cost much more at other hotels. Not sure why there are some negative reviews. The north castle suites are great.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: ramOna3008
Reviews.Content: We expected a better place for the price, location is good if you like to walk a lot to get to the boardwalk, the rooms are Ok but the service wasn't so great, the cleaning person did not replace the shampoo and the soaps every day, we had the feeling that the room was barely cleaned. The hotel is located on the beach, we went for the 4th of july, outside temperature was 90 degrees, but the water in the ocean was freezing. The hotel has a nice pool, which gets overcrowded during weekends. The all you can eat buffet is expensive and the food is horrible. There is nothing good that you can eat. The food is better outside at the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “My dogs have slept in better places”
Reviews.Author: klocco1
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment trip with 4 chihuahuas and 2 teen agers. We stayed in one of the little "cottages" by the hotel (Cottage C1). It was awful, dirty, and the dogs didn't even want to sleep there. Will never do that again! One of my dogs was sniffing behind an end table and I found a bunch of M&M's, need I say more? 1 bedroom with 2 twin beds that were not comfortable. 1 pull out couch, I would have been better sleeping on the beach. The area itself was sketch. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but very far away from everything but the beach”
Reviews.Author: Keeblerelf928
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for 2 nights for a short vacation. Hotel was nice but nothing too elaborate. The theme doesn't carry from the outside to the inside which would have made it much cooler. The elevator didn't always work which was very annoying when I was carrying bags up and down the stairs. The patio bar and restaurant was awesome however the restaurant in the basement of the hotel was a horrible disappointment. It was poorly lit, none of the servers spoke english and the buffet was seriously lacking. If you stay here stick with the outdoor restaurant. They have great entertainment and a menu with a lot of variety. The room was fairly clean and large enough to be comfortable for two people. As long as you stay on a higher floor (I was on the 4th) no matter which side you stay on you get a view of the water. One side is an ocean view, the other side is a bay view. Also to get to the boardwalk you have to take a 10 minute bus ride (2 dollars for the whole day of riding.) Which was a bit annoying for me as I love the boardwalk the most. Overal not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get out of this place fast enough.”
Reviews.Author: melindakohn
Reviews.Content: We chose Castle in the Sand, via internet pics and guidebook from AAA. Believe me, the hotel is nothing like the photos that you see in either of these places. We were tired from driving, and as the place came into view - I thought - well, it's OK. The office staff was friendly enough; but they did ask for a deposit for the room key on top of payment for the room. I've never had this happen before. There are no elevators, so you have to haul your luggage up a narrow set of steps. Our room was a "suite." A bath, kitchen, living room, bedroom; crammed into a tiny amount of space. ALL WERE FILTHY. My bare feet actually stuck to the floor in the kitchen; I didn't want to use any dishes provided there; or use the microwave - which was (you guessed it) filthy. The bedcover was dirty. The room reeked of smoke. Neither one of us was willing to get under the smelly bedcovers. Neither one of us wanted to use the shower. (Keep in mind we were tired and really would have liked to sleep in a decent bed and shower...you get the picture.) The room was over an outdoor bar and it was noisy. The beach it fronts is very narrow. There really were no decent places to eat nearby. We stayed one night and woke up as early as we could - so we'd be able to LEAVE as fast as humanly possible. True, this place had a moderate price. But what is gotten for that moderate price is a sub-par stay. Staying here for even one night was a very bad experience. Unless you are 18 years old and don't care and just want to party - avoid this place as if were the plague.

Reviews.Title: “I feel at home there....”
Reviews.Author: Lawdawg1011
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at Castle in the Sand for over 11 years now. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else. Its feels like home. We started when we had a young daughter who is now grown and we still visit. You never really have to leave the place. In the summer, you have the extra large pool with great lounge chairs, the outside restaurant and bar area and an inside restaurant that serves breakfast buffet and dinner. The nice thing is.. we call and order breakfast sandwiches and stop and pick them up on our way to the beach. Now the outside bar/restaurant is closed after Labor Day. During the summer months, the waitresses will serve your lunch and DRINKS on the beach. The rooms are clean with updated kitchen appliances.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cozy and a little Quirky”
Reviews.Author: RosiePosie67
Reviews.Content: I opted for the less expensive cottage but felt I got excellent value for money. The cottage was very clean, spacious and well stocked (dished in cupboards etc.). Sure it was a little bohemian and had a few quirks, like the tiny bathroom with a closet door held on by nails in the hinges) but was perfectly adequate for a place where most of time was spent out of doors, at the very close beach. Staff was friendly and helpful. Though the cottage is virtually in the parking lot and there was a 'hot rod' convention in town the cottage felt safe and cozy and once the engines were shut off adequately quite. We are campers so it was nice to have beds and bathroom! It wasn't 4 star but we are likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Toes in the sand, Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: ZombieWulfgrl
Reviews.Content: My travel-buddy and I went to O.C. in May and stayed at a hotel that was really old and made my skin crawl. It was a wee bit too low budget for my taste. We had fun anyway and the weather was PERFECT! But when we planned another trip we looked for a different hotel. Especially since the price skyrocketed for the summer months, but nothing had changed at "creepy palace". PRO'S =That's when we found Castle in the Sand - thank goodness! Even though it's 10 blocks off the boardwalk we loved it. They have their own beachfront, which is really sweet, and they'll serve you lunch and DRINKS right on the beach:-) Lunch was quite good and even equitably priced. For a relaxing girlie time away it really fit the bill. The room was clean, the parking convenient, the happy hour GREAT, location very nice (made us exercise). CON'S = They have an interesting cancellation policy - SO Buyer BEWARE (2 weeks, no exceptions)!!! The breakfast buffet was a bit underwhelming, but adequate. Didn't want to try dinner though after seeing what breakfast offered. Price of all the hotels in the area are ridiculous in the summer, but that's why I generally go in the off-season. Much better room, with balcony and oceanfront view INCREDIBLY priced for normal wallets after Labor Day! I'm going back for a second helping with my husband for a romantic/quiet getaway. I'll let you know how that works out.

Reviews.Title: “Castle (Dump) in the Sand”
Reviews.Author: Nicphilz
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I was traveling alone on business. The door handle of the bathroom was broken on the outside which I didn't know. I was in the bathroom, door closed and it locked on me and I couldn't get out. I had to scream for help. When I got out I called the front and stopped down later that day. They did nothing for me, just fixed the door handle. Didn't ask if I was okay, nothing. They were kind of rude in fact. When I checked into the room there was 1 hanger in the closet. I stayed a total of 3 horrible nights. The one day when I came back to my room the maid had not cleaned the bathroom at all. Just changed the towels. Absolutely disgusting. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: mdseit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cottages and my 2 young boys stayed in the 2nd room with the twin beds and were bitten by bed bugs. I told the hotel and they inspected the room and did in fact find bed bugs. They were sincerely sorry and refunded our money, but I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “poor service or not great accomidations, but wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: teayn
Reviews.Content: That pretty much says it all. The service was pretty bad. Was supposed to have food and drink on the hotel beach, but it was nonexistent. Beach was really crowded on nice days. Had to walk over to their beach cafe where the order was wrong every time, so check before you go back to the beach. Food was ok, which is say a lot for ocean city. Didn't eat at their big basement restaurant, but it didn't look appealing and other guests said not to bother. The room wasn't a deal and wasn't great. The view was spectacular (top floor ocean view), but you can't open the windows and the AC roared like a truck. housekeeping was poor. I tipped them $30 the first day and told them to keep us in extra towels, but that was a waste. A lot of the staff is central european and didn't speak english well and didn't have much of a work ethic and gave you attitude. so to sum it up, the view is beautiful from a pricey unkept room in a hotel staffed by people who couldn't speak english well and didn't care about your satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: F00die2010
Reviews.Content: I wanted ocean front with balcony and this filled the bill at reasonable price. Old hotel which has been nicely refurbished. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand...enjoyable vacation spot for family”
Reviews.Author: trainwreck_va
Reviews.Content: Well the family returned to Ocean City, Maryland again and this time did a little research during the prior year and saw this place...liked the beach access a lot and about 10 blocks from the boardwalk. The staff were friendly and nice. They came every day to clean the room and the room was large. We got the North Castle on the third floor. We got the 1 bedroom with two queen size beds, the full kitchen and also included a family room area where the sofa pulled out into a bed and a nice direct view of the ocean. There was plenty of parking never had to fight for any. Also was able to walk to most places we needed to go however did take the bus / shuttle down to 1st street and over to the inlet for dinner… a little rowdy and packed at night when we came back. There is some activities if you have younger children our were 13 and 16 so we were beach, pool and amusement park bound. There is an outside bar and grill that you can order food from and not too bad by the way. You could also order drinks on the beach if I recall correctly and there is the main restaurant in the basement of the North building...sorry never tried it. Overall nice experience and most likely will return next year if the kids want to come back. Sorry did not get any photos of the place this year but they have a web site and pretty much it is what you see.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LoveAvalon
Reviews.Content: My family & I just returned from a great week at the "Castle." Wonderful "island" atmosphere describes this hotel best. We loved being right on the beach and the pool was fun for the kids...especially the diving board. Coconuts was very enjoyable for lunch and a relaxing drink in the evening while the kids enjoyed the volleyball court. They even showed an outdoor movie in the courtyard one night. It was very convenient to Jolly Roger and the boardwalk. We didn't even have to use our car the whole week by using the city bus service that had a stop right outside the hotel. This might not be the newest up-to-date hotel, but it was definitely the best in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated and not worth $200 a night!”
Reviews.Author: novastar10
Reviews.Content: My family didn't expect it to be spotless, being a beach hotel, but it was just old and not a good value. The sheets all had stains, as did most of the towels. There was a cigarette and a booze cup left in our room. My wife and I wore our flipflops on the carpet because it was filthy and had gum on it. I would maybe pay $59 a night, but I still wouldn't expect much!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ToesNdeSand
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far no frills. However, what it lacks in frills it makes up for in its cleanliness and customer service. I see families there year after year that stay the same week we do. I love Coconuts beach Bar as well. They have lots of local entertainment to keep you humming. You have to try a Tipsy Turtle while there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: Juli857
Reviews.Content: Great beach location. We had a splendid time there. The convenience of the kitchenette really makes the difference when traveling with the family. Very clean and confortable.

Reviews.Title: “We would never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ATREGO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Castle every year.The Castle staff are like my family.They are very friendly,and always willing to help.When you stay at the Castle ,you have everything there.The beach bar grill,the beach house resturant,large swimming pool,servers on the beach,and live bands.The rooms are clean,and have great views.We love the Castle,and can't wait to go back next year.Thanks Castle staff for making our stay an enjoyable one!!!!See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Never a Problem at the Castle”
Reviews.Author: EllenTBO
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Castle for about 20 years - my experience this past year was the same as it was years ago - absolutely perfect! The staff was extremely pleasant, the food delicious (especially the beach burger from the outside grill), clean hotel room and NO bugs! Where else can you sit on the hot beach with scalding sand, and not have to leave to get a drink or something to eat - the waitresses from the outside bar/grill will deliver your food/drinks right to you, at no extra charge! And what other hotel has carts for you to take your luggage to your room - this is a big help unloading/loading up the car. Also, the swimming pool is enormous. I was so pleased this year again I made return reservations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Photos are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: ktb415
Reviews.Content: We live in NJ and wanted a nice 4 day weekend getaway. We were really excited about this place because it had two restaurants and a seafood buffet. To start off with the food - horrible. Ok, well the grill outside was okay but the buffet was disgusting! And although they say they have a dresscode in the buffet restaurant they shouldn't. Just imagine the worst restaurant you've ever been to and that was it. Terrible disappointment. Second, we stayed in the Castle South and I guess didn't do enough research because these rooms were soooooo tiny. We even upgraded to one with a kitchen and there was no room to move. Plus they are outdated by about 20 years. To make matters worse, the grill was right outside our window and played loud music until 11pm every night. This is great for young 20somethings who want to party but not for those who have young children. We also had to literally move furniture around to fit our pack-n-play. Third, the service was horrible. All the young people who served us could barely give us a smile and acted like we were inconveniencing them by asking for a high chair. The are two pluses, our view was pretty good, but you have to look beyond the beach grill and volleyball court. Also, we ended up leaving a day early and they did refund us for our last night. Maybe the rooms in the other buildings are nicer, who knows, but do not stay in the Castle South!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations for the price.”
Reviews.Author: KenHNGL
Reviews.Content: The place was great...it is not the Ritz but it's not supposed to be. The staff COULD NOT HAVE BEEN NICER OR MORE HELPFUL. They were great, made excellent golf and restaurant suggestions...just nice people. Location was wonderful. Rooms were clean and beds were firm (good for people with bad backs). We had 12 people in 3 rooms and all were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar...crappy rooms with "ticks"”
Reviews.Author: Empressou
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at one of the Princess hotels, but they were booked, so we decided to try Castle in the Sand. The bar was a blast...music, 2 for 1 drinks bet 5 & 6 pm, just a fun, island vibe. But that's where the fun ended for me. We booked 2 rooms; one for us, one for the teenagers. We took the one with newer-looking carpeting and bedspreads. The "demon" showers ran hot to cold ANY time we showered (in both rooms). In our bathroom, the linoleum was peeling up by the door and there was crud under it that could be seen while sitting on the toilet. BTW, the toilet handle had to be jiggled after EVERY flush. The sink and countertop had seen better days. As we were packing to leave, my daughter mentioned she had found a "tick" in my granddaughter's pack & play. I knew immediately that it was no "tick" That's right, folks, it was a BEDBUG! As I was totally freaked out by this, I demanded that everyone leave their luggage in the garage when we returned home and wash EVERY piece of clothing, pillows, blankets, etc. that we took on the trip. I should have known there were issues when I noticed the mattresses and boxsprings were encased with covers. That's usually not a good sign...I know this as I travel alot for work. Bottom line...you can't be too careful when you travel and you definitely don't want any "hitchhikers" coming home w/you in your luggage or belongings. Bedbugs are INCREDIBLY hard to eradicate once they've taken up residence in your home. I had a customer this happened to once and it wasn't cheap, she had to buy a new mattress set and have new carpeting installed in her bedroom. Take your money and stay elsewhere in OCMD.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...”
Reviews.Author: fitter32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I don't usually put too much emphasis on our hotel. We don't tend to spend too much time in them when on vacation. That being said... clean and fresh is a must. The Bad: Castle In The Sand, while clean, had the funky smell of cleaning agents and old smoke. I can only assume this used to be a smoke friendly establishment because there was definitely a smokey funk abound. Everytime I entered our room, I said to my wife, "stinky". That was the first thought that crossed my mind. My other gripe about our room would be the shower. Scalding hot or ice cold! No more than 1/8th of a turn on the cold knob would make that much of a difference. One day we dicided to have lunch at Coconut's, the hotel's outdoor bar/restaurant. We sat down at 1-oclock, but they had a band playing that was so loud you couldn't talk, think or order food... so we went elsewhere. And just to clarify, I'm 36, I like concerts and partys, and I've had great times at other hotels. I just don't want concert volume music when I'm having lunch! Ironically enough, on Saturday night we decided to stop at the bar for a couple of drinks around 10-oclock and there was no music whatsoever??? The Good: The location is great! Just a short walk across the dunes to a very nice beach. They have a nice volleyball court, bar side. They have a large pool with diving board and 10ft deep end. And... our room had a great view! If you intend to spend much time on the Boardwalk however... plan on driving or renting a scooter to get there. It's about 10 blocks to the northern most point of the boardwalk, which goes south another 30+ blocks (rides and games at the southern most end).

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation--can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: rjt10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City, we were a bit apprehensive arriving over the July 4th holiday but decided to give it a try. We arrived early in the afternoon to find that our room on the 5th floor of the north penthouse was ready for us--the manager on duty was extremely welcoming. We walked into our room and were greeted with the most amazing view of the beach and ocean not to mention that although the hotel is a bit dated, our room was extremely clean and comfortable. The food in the restaurant was good and the entertainment and food at the patio bar was excellent. We enjoyed being on the quieter end of the strip--we took the bus to the boardwalk ($2.00 a day) each evening for some shopping and great sightseeing. We enjoyed our stay so much that we are already planning another stay.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay...”
Reviews.Author: jr4div2
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Castle for a week. We had an ocean front efficiency room and the view was beautiful. Although the room was a little dated, it was generally well maintained. There were a few negatives, however. Our bed was very uncomfortable. My husband and I both had back pain during the trip due to the bed. Also, the daily cleaning was not the best. They did not even empty and clean out the coffee pot each day. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was OK..Nothing spectacular. One of the big draws for my husband to this hotel was the beach servers. They were not as readily available as one might think. Overall, I guess we would stay here again in a pinch. However, I think I want to consider other places, first.

Reviews.Title: “not what it appears to be”
Reviews.Author: ALXBRT
Reviews.Content: Internet photos and description do not give an accurate picture of the true condition of the hotel. The hotel is much older than it appears on line. We stayed in an ocean front room. The view was beautiful. There were plumbing problems. The toilet was not working properly...had to lift lid and jiggle the handle to get it to work. The shower water pressure was terrible...reminded me of a lawn sprinkler. Maid service consists of trash emptied and towels placed on unmade bed. The people at the front desk were not welcoming. They appeared to be annoyed and disliked the job they were doing. Treated in a cold..condescending manner. The beach was very nice. The hotel restaurant.. seafood buffet was good for the price...However,I was surprised that they added an 18% tip to the bill since they didnt really serve us...We served ourselves. There were only four of us. The server only brought us drinks. Owners really need to look at management .. how guests are treated and how concerns are handled...plumbing needs to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! WHEN CAN WE GO BACK?”
Reviews.Author: catlo53
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! That is all that I can say. Fell in love with the Castle in the Sand at first phone call.. Helpful from the start with arranging the trip and finding the right room and then, when we arrived....What a friendly environment with everything that a famity with a variety of ages and interests could ask for. The room was inviting and clean with comfortable beds that seemed bigger than the doubles that they advertised and air conditioning that could be well regulated so that it didn't freeze you during the night. The room was quiet...i didn't even know that there were families with children near us. The free videos where a delight after a day at the beach made us happy to retreat to the room for a while and when we needed a better way to get home they gave us directions that made the trip a lot more direct. For a wonderful time at a home away from home that will be delight to return to year after year. the Castle in the Sand is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JenntheDiver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during an impromptu weekend trip to the beach. We could not have been happier with the hotel - it's in a great location and only a short walk to the boardwalk. We had an oceanfront room with great views and we never saw or heard another guest on our floor. It was very quiet (and I'm sensitive to noise and had prepared by bringing ear plugs - never needed them). Our beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was spotless. It was great to have the beach bar open and the waitresses on the beach. Nothing like sipping a pina colada while dipping our toes in the ocean! The food at the hotel was great and they allowed us a late check-out at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ferremar
Reviews.Content: Overall we really liked the hotel and would definitely stay again. It's clean and the staff is VERY nice, friendly and helpful. The room is a bit outdated but if you don't care about that, then there's absolutely nothing to worry about. The only "negative" I would say (and mind you, its not really a negative) but I feel like I should mention it, are the "oceanfront" rooms at Castle South (which is the main building-where the office is). Technically, the rooms ARE oceanfront because they DO face the ocean but realistically if I am booking an oceanfront room, I would not stay in this building. The building has 3 floors (we stayed on the 2nd floor) and the balconies that are advertised as "oceanfront" are DIRECTLY in front of the outdoor restaurant Coconuts and the "hang out" area which has beach chairs and a beach volleyball court. Now this is nice..you can sit on the balcony, listen to the music below (on the weekends live music) and watch all the action but you can barely see the ocean. You see a little bit of the ocean in the distance and what you see are the sand dunes. So I just need to mention this because if I had known that the "oceanfront" rooms are really in front of the restaurant/music/hangout area, I would have booked a room in another building. And just to repeat, this is not a deciding factor in terms of choosing this hotel. Everything else about this hotel is great..just know that if you want a "true" oceanfront experience do not stay in Castle South.

Reviews.Title: “Change of opinion”
Reviews.Author: 41045Keith36
Reviews.Content: 2nd time around so much better then the first. friendly staff, house keeping was on top of it all. A perfect place for families, couples, or someone on business what ever your needs the will be catered to. CLEAN, FRIENDLY, SAFE, AND A LOT OF ENTERTAINMENT FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES... Thank you so much for the 2nd chance!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Business Practice”
Reviews.Author: bluknight12
Reviews.Content: Had intentions of staying four nights at this place. Initially the front desk was very friendly upon check-in. Then it started. The beds in our particular room were horrible. Had I stayed there the last two nights, I surely would have wound up at the chiropractor. The walls were paper thin, as my wife could not even sleep the first night with all the noise and chatter heard throughout the night. We found two carpenter's nails on the floor that my wife almost stepped on from careless or sloppy work, I guess. No windows to open for air, a noisy room air conditioner and a broken security chain lock on the door leading to the deck. But most of all, when we checked out early to leave the place, the desk manager could have cared less about my complaints as he was too busy training two cute girls at the front desk, it seemed anyway. When he heard about by complaints to the young lady who printed out my final bill, the only thing he did was interject that we don't offer any refunds for early check out. My father always taught me as a business person, that the customer is always right. NO refund for a horrible stay, not even a meet me half way and offer a one night refund, shame on you. What a poor business practice. Then to boot the front desk manager asked me if I would be returning anytime soon Hah. With the thousands of hotels in Ocean City, I think one could find some place better than this one. Look around.

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand - HEAVEN!”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Castle in the Sand. Great family friendly hotel, wonderful rooms, great staff, so much to enjoy. The rooms are great, roomy and perfect for families. Everyone has their own space and no overcrowding like many hotels. If you are lucky enough to get an oceanfront hotel - PERFECT! The restaurant offers a great breakfast buffet (coupon available in Sunny Day). The pool bar has great snacks for while you are playing in the sand, oceanfront pool, ocean, or just taking in the rays. During the summer, they have a great kids program with magicians, face painting, and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “It truly is your Dream Castle and more!”
Reviews.Author: IslandDreamsMaryland
Reviews.Content: It's the only Hotel I want to stay in while visiting Ocean City, MD, for business or pleasure. It's seems when it's business, it always fulfills my expectations, in turn gives me pleasure. Looking onto the ocean from my balcony early in the morning or late at night is so relaxing, calming and a feeling of being off on an Island somewhere. Housekeeping always spoils me. The location is great! Best pool in Town! I always have fun and feel welcomed at the Castle and "Coconuts Beach Bar" is unbelievable, good food and great music on the weekends. Always something fun happening including Social events. The Staff makes me feel like a "VIP". You don't ever feel like you are bothing the Staff. The Staff always have time to please you. I love when I drive up to the Castle, but I hate it, when it's time to leave. My home away from home, that's my "Castle". Can't wait for another execuse to get away, but this time it will be before September and more!

Reviews.Title: “Felt very welcome”
Reviews.Author: stanleyBaltimore_Md
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a gift certificate to the Castle for Christmas and wanted to use it in the off season. We are big fans of the hotel and love to be at the beach when it's quiet and the shops are still open and the restaurants offer great specials. We didn't realize the hotel would be closed when we wanted to visit but when we called, the reservationist offered us one of the hotel condos for the weekend. We were to arrive after work on Fri. and a person from the front office waited for us to arrive and made sure we got settled in. The condo had the heat, lights and music on so we felt very welcome. We found the unit beautifully decorated and the bath and kitchen spotless. A lovely view of the beach and ocean greeted us when we opened the blinds. The staff that was working over the weekend checked made feel at home and we will definitely be back in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: cloudy2
Reviews.Content: Tried to save a little money by staying here. The rooms were terrible. We had a 2 room efficiency. Only AC was in the livingroom. The bedroom was so hot. Had to leave on the ac in livingroom to cool off bedroom which made the livingroom to cold. Very noisy place. Check in is at exact time. Had to wait the 5 minutes to the check in hour. Very rude. If going with little kids and you like a lot of noise, its fine. Also had no cell phone signal in room. Had to go downstairs to pick up wireless. Buffet downstairs is terrible. Thought it would be easy having it there but it stunk.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ragdoll4me
Reviews.Content: First they were sandblasting the entire Condo building making all of us filthy from the elevator to the condo. Everything was covered in construction dust, not to mention the noise in the mornings when the workers began to work. The noise was DEAFENING! My husband ,who has breathing problems suffered terribly. Even I had challenges breathing! We were never told. Then when we went to check out on the last day we were charged thirty dollars more for the last day than we were quoted from an employee and they refused to honor what she originally quoted. The unit had a funny odor and was just a dissapointment all around

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: OCTerpsGirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Castle in the Sand hotel for many years and would never stay anywhere else. Coconuts Beach Restaurant has a great happy hour with a variety of food as well as live music.

Reviews.Title: “Great beachfront location; would come back to stay again”
Reviews.Author: pjorey
Reviews.Content: We came during the off-season, so the rates were reasonable. Room was small, with two double beds, but there were just the two of us and space was not an issue. The room offered everything we could need. Having the little kitchenette was a nice bonus too. Balcony overlooked the beach. The hotel is not on the boardwalk, which was great; it made for a quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation destination for families”
Reviews.Author: sfoozball55
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the best hotels in the Ocean City area. I always used to come as a kid and stay with our family and now I am able to come back as an adult and see how great the accommodations actually are. In the height of the summer there is always to much to do to fit it into only one week, but in October it is a great destination for comfort and relaxation. The staff is always the friendliest and the rooms are luxurious. I have already booked my 2 vacations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Rates for Seniors”
Reviews.Author: SunFunBeachFan
Reviews.Content: Our granddaughter attends college in Salisbury and when we drove from Pittsburgh to visit her we chose to stay in Ocean City rather than Salisbury so we could also visit the beach! It was only about a half hour drive from Salisbury. We had originally booked our stay for Friday and Saturday night, but we ended up staying 2 extra days because the hotel had a $39 senior rate on Sunday and the weekdays! We were thrilled with the price and our granddaughter was thrilled that we were staying longer. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable and had a little kitchen area. The ocean view from our balcony could not get any better! Since it is considered the off season now in Ocean City, not everything in town was open as far as restaurants, but the front desk staff was really friendly and accommodating and gave us a lot of great suggestions of places to go for dinner! Even though we stayed in October, we were surprised that the weather was still pretty nice...not too cold. Our granddaughter stayed with us in the hotel 2 of the nights and she loved it too! We wanted to come back in January for another visit but the hotel buildings will be closed for the season, they do however rent their condos year round so that is what we plan to do! Overall - great hotel, friendly staff, clean room, reasonable rates, great location!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: OceanPainter
Reviews.Content: My wife slept under the covers and started itching about our 3rd day there! I have to sleep sitting up, so I slept in a chair with my own pillow and quilt. A week later she is suffering terribly, having been to the ER twice and to our primary care doctor once. Diagnosis? Scabies/Bed Bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sissypwr
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much. First trip to Ocean City, MD with my family, including two toddlers. We stayed in a Waverly Castle Ocean Front Efficiency. Well, it was a great place with anything and everything one could want or need: Dining, entertainment, volleyball, end of season children's crafts and fun, great beach with cocktail service if you can believe it! We will most certainly be back again. Also, this place isn't that far at all from the lovely O.C. Boardwalk, but if it's peak season and approaching the evening the traffic can be bad. The area has a lot of entertainment and amusement parks and dining. Similar to Virginia Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room overlooking ocean at an excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: vernawilles
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Castle in the Sand! The hotel staff was very friendly, accommodating, and helpful. The hotel was older, but obviously renovated and well maintained. The room was large and immaculate. The location was terrific....right on the beach, so we did not have to walk far to sit by the ocean! The hotel also has a large, beautiful, lap pool, outdoor cafe with music, and is landscaped lovely! There are several buidings in the complex, very charming! The price was very affordable. I will definitely return! BTW, the location on the ocean seemed to be a good one for surfers, and we had fun watching them!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but needs some things . . .”
Reviews.Author: MarciaM
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront suite, and the view from these rooms is absolutely beautiful. There's a nice private balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. The view of the dunes and the ocean cannot be beat. The much-touted Beach House Restaurant closes (for dinner) on Labor Day. We arrived at the hotel 2 days after Labor Day; wanted to go off-season, so at the last minute we had to find somewhere to eat dinner (don't recommend Jonah and the Whale). The restaurant is still open for breakfast, and the food is pretty good. Since it rained the ENTIRE time we were at the beach, we spent more time than usual in the room - the tv was not good - not good at all; rather small and old and the picture was bad. I LOVED the tiny little kitchen! Stove, microwave, sink, and nice little frige - it was great. As I understand it, there is wi-fi available in the restaurant only; can't get ANY connection in the rooms, so that was a huge letdown, since we spent so much time in the room.The beds are rather comfortable, but I always take my pillows from home - their's were like round balls. The girls that were working at the check in desk, well I can't really say anything good or bad about them. They were weren't unfriendly, but they were what I would call friendly either. This is not a "luxurious" type of hotel, but you don't always want that type of hotel for a beach vacation - sometimes you want more casual, and this fits the ticket. You must drive to most places (like Dunkin Donuts and the Boardwalk) but not far, I believe the boardwalk is 10 blocks away. Since it was raining, we didn't swim in the pool, but it looks amazing! Huge, beautiful, and immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel on the beach, and away from the noise.”
Reviews.Author: peelerusa
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to O.C.M.D. and we came to the Castle based upon a recommendation from friends. We booked a 1st floor suite that opened up to the beach which we found more convienient than the upper floors could have been. Our room had a patio and lounge chairs. Just steps away were the Tiki bar where live music played daily . Altough the ocean view was obstructed by sand dunes, the trade off for the convenience of having the beach outside of our door was well worth it. The suite also had a convienient back door which led to a great pool area. The pool was clean and large from 3' to 10' deep. With a full sized kitchen, it felt very homey. Although the beds were well worn in and somewhat lumpy, we managed to have a comfortable stay. The kids resorted to putting the mattress from the pull-out sofa right on the floor since one night of sleeping on the sofa bed was too torturous to endure for a week. Housekeeping staff was attentive and very efficient. We had a problem with a vibrating wall at night in the bedroom which kept us up most of the night, but the problem was resolved the next day when a blower fan was identified to be the culprit. The fan was turned off at 6PM every night thereafter and was no longer a problem If you book room 108 in the North bldg and experience a sleepless night due to a vibrating wall and headboard, simply ask the desk clerk to have the blower motor in the elevator shaft turned off. We found that Coconuts served tasty food, but their mixed drinks seemed to be watered down....stick to drinking beer to play it safe. The hotel was perfectly located and within walking distance to the Jolly Rodger water park and Go-Karts. We found that most of the restaurants in the immediate area served food which was only mediocre. If you want a decent dinner, take a short ride into West Ocean Beach off of Rt.50. There are plenty of eateries in that area which serve much better food than what is in the tourist trap. All in all, the Castle was a nice family hotel. we would come again, but hopefully by then they will have newer matresses...

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty, Ant Infested, Needs Complete Renovation”
Reviews.Author: EnglishMaria
Reviews.Content: I have always trusted Tripadvisor reviews and hotel website information and photographs before booking a hotel - but I am afraid I will have to re-think this after our experience at 'The Castle'. This hotel seems to have so many rave reviews, It is almost as though these people stayed somewhere completely different! We paid a $200/night discounted rate for our Castle North ocean front 'suite', the website pictures of the rooms are VERY misleading, and our hearts absolutely sank when we walked into the dingy, dark and dirty rooms that would be our home for the next 7 days. I do not know where to begin. All of the furniture is so old and musty, the mattress in our bedroom was covered in multiple cigarette burns, the carpet was dark, filthy and musty, indeed wet from the air conditioning unit. The kitchen units were the original ones from when the hotel was built 50 years ago - they just painted over them a dark green color and the furniture all looked like it had been salvaged curbside in a bad neighborhood. There were so many chips and damages, rusty light fitting, gaps under the door, an ant infestation - the ants were all over the kitchen counter all of the time so not one morsel of food could be left out of the fridge. My baby's bib was crawling with them when I left it on the counter one day. The toilet was stained, not working properly, dripping taps, dirty windows and mirrors, this place did not smell or look clean by any stretch. I spent all the time cleaning just so that my baby would not be exposed to who knows what. We stayed 2 nights of the 7 we booked and I could not sleep for those 2 nights - the bedding was very uncomfortable and smelt so musty I could not be sure they were even changed from the previous occupants. We complained to management, and we were given a refund of the remainder of our stay, plus one of the two nights. We left there and checked into the Princess Royale, what a difference!!! Clean, modern, beautiful, granite counters in the room... and I will review this hotel separately on our return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel to visit with your family with young children.”
Reviews.Author: yankeesnewyorker
Reviews.Content: This is a great place if your family likes large swimming pools and the ocean nearby, so no tough choices need to be made amoung family members. There's lots to do in the nearby area on rainy days. The Coconuts restaurant serves great food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “We Have Stay There Every Year , For the Last 20 Years!”
Reviews.Author: loyalpal300
Reviews.Content: Very helpful at check in and out, great pool (no less then 3 life guards on duty) 8am to 9 pm, great access to ocean, the beach house restaurant makes great food,They even deliver food and drinks to the beach. House cleaning personnel were very helpful. Secure Parking lot. Not far from boardwalk ,I had a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love The Castle"”
Reviews.Author: jessie223
Reviews.Content: I loved the atmosphere at the Castle. This was my first time going to this place and I was absolutely blown away by the hotel and amenities. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I loved that it was right on the beach, with a bar and restaurant serving on the beach. It was a nice place to be for a weekend trip. There was alot to do...beach, bar, restaurant, boardwalk. Prices for drinks and food were very reasonable. Rooms were very clean. I would definitely reccommend this place to others. We plan to go back next summer and bring our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Castleinthesand
Reviews.Content: Our first time here in four generations at another hotel. We ended our trip with our usual hotel, becuase of the holiday weekend rates, but we will never stay at the old hotel again. Castle in the sand has won us over. Breathtaking views from the Castle North, huge room, big, full kitchen. Staff ensures that you have a great time. Kids activities are great, my kids were there every day, 2 and 6 yrs old. Pool was sparkling clean, and huge. Movie night was lots of fun. Great live music each day. So easy to walk onto the beach. Breakfast buffet was affordable, and food was good. The only downside was the beds were a little uncomfortable, and the food at the grill was a little overpriced, but most things are these days!! Great place to stay in a beautiful, quiet part of town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Castle in the Sand.”
Reviews.Author: melster74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to OC Maryland on a last minute whim. When we got there we were turned away by 2 hotels that had vacancy signs because we were only looking to book for one night and they have a 2 night minimum stay. (Silly me...I thought a hotel would rather rent out a room for a night then have it sit vacant and get nothing....but who the heck am I?) Anyway...thats when we came upon Castle in the Sand. I figured I would have the same lousy luck with this hotel because it looked so nice and it appeared to be super busy. Well...as luck would have it - they had a vacancy and were willing to rent it for a night. The staff was very friendly and explained the room to me (2 bed efficiency suite) before we agreed to rent it. We were not able to check in until 4pm but they even had someone there to turn on the air condition unit so that the room was comfortable when we walked in. The decor was charming. It felt as if we were staying at grandmas beach cottage for the weekend. I can not say enough good things about Castle in the Sand. What I can say is that in the future we will be sure to book with them in advance without even bothering to seek out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar View at Hundred Dollar Price!”
Reviews.Author: SandCrawler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from The Castle in the Sand at Ocean City, MD. We had an Ocean Front Penthouse room and could not believe the bargain. We were able to open the blinds every morning to watch the sunrise from our bed and then at the end of the day we would come back and watch it set. It didn't matter if it was windy or cold we had the perfect seat in our room. The best day was when the moon came up orange and lit up a streak along the ocean pointing to our room. The water was so close that we could go out at any time for a quick dip in the ocean and then come back to our room and get changed for the night-life (plenty within walking distance) - We also had the breakfast and dinner buffets so I have to admit we didn't leave the hotel building at all one day (which was perfect for the wedding couple we met there ; ) There is also the Coconuts Bar and beach volleyball and a big pool on the ground floor for even more things to do. We definitely can't wait until next year. (p.s. on the way home we stopped by Asseteague Island to see the wild horses - it is only 8 miles away!)

Reviews.Title: “Why we love The Castle”
Reviews.Author: GuessWhoYonkersNY
Reviews.Content: We go back to the Castle In The Sand every year since we discovered it! Our summer is not complete unless we visit for at least a long weekend. We had vacationed in Ocean City before but we had a completely different vacation once we visited the castle. My child cried all the way home and on the couch when we came home this year. The rooms are set up to enjoy the layout of the pool and beach. The pool is large and located close to the bar and grill. The beach is right there as well. There is waitress serivce on the beach, volleyball, daily entertainment at the bar and kids activities all afternoon everyday but saturday. The difference about their activities is that they are outdoor as opposed to inside a cold conference room. There are no charges and the two ladies who run the program take an individual interest in each child and make them feel very special. Once you experience the castle you won't want to go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ferrarafamily
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Saturday with ease, and were swimming in the ocean shortly after. Had a nice corner penthouse room which was plenty big enough for our family of 5. Rooms are a little dated, could use some updating. Shower pressure was really bad also. Our kids 6 and 4 really enjoyed the kids activities and the pool with diving board. We ate lunch at coconuts and that was also very nice. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: Housekeeper does not knock!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2ValleyGirls
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the last weekend in August. We arrived on a Saturday , the room was clean and we were pretty satisfied with it. However, the next day while I was in the bathroom the maid unlocked the door and walked right on in. My husband told her we were Ok and she replied "No"!! He told her again we were good (remember at this point we were only there less than 48 hours and we made our own beds). She finally walked out. After hearing this I opened the door to see if she was still there. I saw her cart outside the next room with a clipboard on it (I looked at it to see if maybe there was a mistake and she thought the room was suppose to be empty). No, our room number said "occupied" next to it. We went to the office later and let them know it was bizarre and they agreed she is suppose to knock. They stated someone would take care of it. Well the next day she did it again!! Walked right in past my daughters in the bedroom and into the living room area where i was. The whole maid experience was strange and unsettling. Consider yourself warned!

Reviews.Title: “Location was awesome, views are awesome, and kids love it”
Reviews.Author: seashellsearcher
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation to Ocean City, Md, and we decided to stay at Castle in the Sand by browsing their website. We asked for a room with a view of the ocean, and they put us in the waverly castle 4th floor, with the most breath taking views. The children's activities are awesome, face painting, crafts including making faces on seashell, puppet shows and movie night under the stars. We were literally 10 steps away from the beach. The pool was so well supervised with 2 life guards. The staff there were extremely friendly and helpful, everyone always had a smile. oh and the breakfast buffet was excellent for the price. I am definitely returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun for everyone”
Reviews.Author: beachluvvvv2009
Reviews.Content: I love castle in the sand everyone is so friendly and nice. The is pool beautiful and you have an awesome view of the beach. It is so clean there and it is a very family orientated place. They have volleyball there which you can also play which is a lot of fun!!! Theres also a buffet that has resonable prices and great food. This place is awesome they have a bar too!!! Theres something there for everyone that they will enjoy!!! You will never want to leave, I know i didn't !!! So if you want too have a lot of fun castle in the sand is the place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “always a smile”
Reviews.Author: jimg5303
Reviews.Content: I first went to the castle over thirty years ago, lots has changed in Ocean City, and even the castle, its much bigger. One thing hasnt changed though in all these years, The friendliness of the owners and the staff,. Whats really amazing it REAL ...We have gone two and three years in a row, ad then not for ten years, but when you walk in the door, its like old home week, you get that friendly smile,that please and thank you, and this last time I found the owner out there working with the staff, he was filling the soda machines. Its very much a family place, where everyone relaxes, have nice conversations, and friendships are struck for a lifetime. We met an older couple there thirty years ago and stayed friends and in contact with them till their death. Theres lots to do , they are centrally located, the rooms are clean, the beach is wonderful, the pool is great, and so is the little restaurant, Coconuts. I can tell you one thing, this is a family orientated, clean place, thats fairly price, not inflated like alot of places, and trust me when I say, I'll be back.. I mean it..

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand treats you like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Penny051
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here for an end of summer beach getaway. Staff great. Had made reservations and then forgot to make sure I could get a first floor room due to elderly person's needs that I was traveling with. Called back about one week later and they were able to meet my needs. Best kept secret that I really don't want to divulge is that they have restaurant service at the beach. Food arrived in a timely manner and was delicious. Would definitely stay here again. Have been going to Ocean City, Md for 29 years and this place was one of the best I stayed at yet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family with young children”
Reviews.Author: vernon074
Reviews.Content: Castle in the Sand Hotel was perfect for my family with boys 7 & 8. We had a suite room with a balcony overlooking the ocean with a kitchen. The beach is a very short distance from the hotel. The pool was awesome to use my 8 year old's word. The hotel is kid friendly and conveniently located near the boardwalk and other Ocean City attractions. If we didn't want to prepare our own meals, the restaurant and outdoor grill had plenty on the menu from which adults and children could choose.

Reviews.Title: “Cute cottages / great location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa7363
Reviews.Content: We arrived in OC without reservations. Got a cottage room right away for a very reasonable price. Waited at the outdoor beach bar for an hour until we could check in (4pm). They had a great band - very beachy place. Cottage was clean, had great a/c, full kitchen, living room, linens, porch with chairs to hang out and view the strip, nice pool. Short walk to the beach. We even stayed an extra day. A definate "inexpensive" week-end getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lsbg14
Reviews.Content: Castle in the Sand has been one of the best vacation destinations for my family. My children now the ages of 18 - 23 still prefer going to Castle in the Sand in Ocean City MD than any other place. The location on the beach is the best. The staff is great and the pool is wonderful. It's the only place I know with a diving board. We have been going there for over five years and they only want to stay at the Castle. The rooms are clean and some have been updated. The oceanview is the best. The entertainment is also terrific great crowd of people. I will only stay at the Castle when I vacation in Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Affordable, and Tons of Fun”
Reviews.Author: anthony5179
Reviews.Content: For the best family vacation in Ocean City N, there is only one place: CASTLE IN THE SAND HOTEL. THE pool is huge and sparkling, the beach is beautiful and clean,our cottage is clean and comfortable. The entire staff; MATT (in the office), JAYSON (housekeeping), JOE (coconuts) are all great. and of course LADY SUNSHINE AND LADY J are the childrens favorites. This year was our seventh straight! See you next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view and pool experiences”
Reviews.Author: oceanwatchOhio
Reviews.Content: The Soverign of the Sea Condo related to the hotel was clean, large and well furnished. We overlooked the beach, and the Coconuts patio where we could listen to music every alternoon from our balcony. The 3 & 5 year olds enjoye the large pool.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love the castle”
Reviews.Author: karenPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach. Great bar/grill with live music everyday from 1-5pm. Seemed like great kid activities...but we didn't bring our kids this trip! Fun volleyball court.

Reviews.Title: “"Why we love The Castle"”
Reviews.Author: Gracie1012A
Reviews.Content: My experience with The Castle began 50 years ago when it first opened. The Showell's wanted to purchase the property between their new hotel and the cottages my parents were renting... however they ended up buying the cottages also. Over the years, the Castle has grown from one building and the cottages to the family vacation destination it is in 2009. Over the years, there have been many changes but the quality of service from the staff is still great. The first pool has been replaced by an 25 meter olympic size pool. For your dining pleasure, Coconuts Beach Bar and Grill is within a few steps from the beach and patio along with Footprints Pub and the Beach House Restaurant located in Castle North. There is a volley ball court, a game room and activities for the younger set. Now my grandchildren eagarly await their week at the Castle each summer. I have been asked many times why we keep returning to the Castle. I tell them I cannot imagine going on vacation any other place in Ocean City...It's like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Old is not always quaint and charming, sometime it is just old and outdated.”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler048
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in for the amount of money we spent! Every aspect of the "so called" suite was extremely small, old (had not been updated in decades), dirty, and uncomfortable. We stayed in room 25, on the second floor, overlooking the pool and the Coconut Bar/volleyball area. All the furniture was definitely purchased at the Salvation Army,.... as is. The old, old TV didn't work at first and we had to buy a inflatable mattress to sleep on the sofa-bed. The bathroom was extremely dirty, worn-outdated decor, a chipped toilet seat, and the residue of a old bath mat stuck in the tub. The best thing about the place was the location of the hotel to the beach. That was great. I recommend that you ask to see your room before you check-in or definitely stay some place else. The room they advertise is nothing near what you might get.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love the Castle”
Reviews.Author: dafays
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th year at Castle in the Sand and each trip has just gotten better. It's on the beach, the pool is huge and our cottage is always clean and ready for us, and the staff is warm and welcoming. Each year it seems they add something new for the family to do together- this years addition was a family movie night at Coconuts. Castle in the Sand has become a summer tradition that we all count down the days to.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love The Castle”
Reviews.Author: MAB001
Reviews.Content: This will be our 5th year at Castle in the Sand and as much as I would like to keep it a secret so that I do not have to worry about not getting the reservation I want, I just have to let you know this is a whole different world. Yes, you are in OC however there is live music from 1-4 which is heard even at the pool and one of the only parts of the beach that serve refreshments including frozen drinks. They have a D.J. on Friday nights to start off the weekend and an all you can eat buffet that is a great deal for the price. Just be prepared to waddle back to your room. This year they added an outdoor movie night with popcorn and candy. Nothing better than sitting in the sand watching a movie. It is one of the only hotels that once we unpack my children and I feel like we are home and the kids love those smiley fries. Thanks for a great vacation look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone, young to old!”
Reviews.Author: islandlover28
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Castle for 20 years now. When we started, we stayed there so our kids could join in the kiddie activities and now they are joining us for 2 for 1 happy hour. We rarely leave the premises with everything we need right there. Located right on the beach, when someone is tired of the sun and sand, they can retire to the pool, volley ball court,restaurant, bar or room. There are daily activites and music and,though very family friendly, it is like a party every day! I haven't found anything else so all encompassing on the east coast! How many teenagers want to go on vacation with their parents anymore? But our kids are still going with us well into their college years and it is a tradition we plan to keep up!

Reviews.Title: “why we love the castle”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyCocoa
Reviews.Content: I was in Ocean City for a business conference and brought my wife and 3 kids. We stayed in the waverly castle which was perfect for my family. there were two beds and a pullout sofa, a kitchenette, parking right in front of the door. This was my 2nd time at this hotel this summer. The food at coconuts is great, especially the jerk mahi mahi. The 2 for 1 happy hour cant be beat either. Perfect location for the beach, within walkin distance of a full grocery/liquor store. The kids loved the pool as well as the daily activitiies.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: lncmrtnz
Reviews.Content: it was just a wonderful trip and the view of the ocean from the hotel room was wondeful, seeing the sunrise was just beautiful and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you see on the website is what you get!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tweetydozier
Reviews.Content: My family and I truly enjoyed our stayed at Castle in the Sand. Like the websites promotes, it's everything you could imagine. Everything is so conviently located around this hotel. Just park and walk. The food, service and hospitality was great. No problems at all. We will definitely make this an annual trip since our stay was so great. We hated to leave!!!! The two-for-one happy hour is out of this world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why we love The Castle.”
Reviews.Author: DrivingFool_100
Reviews.Content: We took a chance that Castle in the Sand would be the right place for our short visit to Ocean City and were extremely pleased with our choice. Our trip was designed to make our sister-in-law feel better, as she was recently diagnosed with a serious medical condition. And it worked. Our first-floor, ocean side room as clean and spacious, the view peaceful and the noise...non-existent. Service people were all cheerful, even near the end of the summer! The location was perfect for us beach lovers and shoppers alike. I would highly recommend Castle in the Sand to others. In fact, I already did.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kurlygirl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for the past 3 years on family vacation with a 11, 17, and 23 year old and never had a complaint. We stay the same week as our cousins who have been coming to Castle in the Sand for the past 10 years. The people are friendly and helpful, the rooms and common areas are clean and well kept and in addition to a huge pool...you are only steps from the beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: StevekConnecticut
