Reviews.Content: We decided to do a last minute trip to OC. My brother has been there before and gave us a few choices in hotels. Castle in the Sand was one of them. Since it was our first trip OC our first choice was Park Place which is right on the board walk but the only room available was overlooking the bar. It was more expensive too. We visited the hotel and were glad we didn't stay there.. too much hustle and crowded beaches. Castle in the Sand only had a room with ocean view for one night and the second night we would have to move to parking lot view. We decided to go for it. Our room was large and clean. It had two full size beds.. Queen would have been nicer. No balcony but the entire wall facing the ocean was all window so waking up in the morning and looking over the ocean was exceptional. We ate diner and lunch at the hotel restaurants which were not over priced. Wife is a vegetarian and there wasn't much available for her. They did adjust the buffet price to accommodate her vegetable picking which was nice. Friendly staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Castle in the Sand Hotel - A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: banker05
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Castle in the Sand Hotel for 10 plus years. My family and I have always enjoyed out stay there. The rooms are always clean, the service good and waiters /waitresses very friendly. The atmosphere is very relaxing. We now come here with other members of my family and we already booked our stay there for next year. A very enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Why we love the castle”
Reviews.Author: countrygirlmom46
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in OC, most fun for our kids, they loved Miss Sunshine and Lady J who had the funest activites everyday, best duos playing music in the afternoons for mom and dad to enjoy, best drinks at the Coconuts Bar & Grill and best food, happy hour everyday with buy 1 get 1 free on any drink, best crab cake I ever had served at the grill with great prices, best olympic size pool and very clean with pool side bar & grill service, best beach side service from the bar & grill, umbrella rentals and chair rentals and even boogie board rentals at great prices, nice beautiful and clean rooms with awesome view, perfect kitchenette and closet and nice bathroom, very courteous staff always willing to help and get you anything you need, very courteous office staff and very helpful, great food in beautiful restaurant with great service for breakfast and dinner. Volleyball court. Will return to Castle In The Sand every year that we come to Ocean City. Close to everything you could want. Could not ask for anything more perfect. Staff were always working very hard to make everything perfect for everyone and make the place run smoothly and neat and clean. Thank you so very much!

Reviews.Title: “Castle regulars and loving it”
Reviews.Author: vacationkat50
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Castle for 22 straight years. We just returned from our second visit of the summer, a reunion with family. The Castle has it all from clean beaches with a wait staff to the largest pool in OC. Over the years, our children have enjoyed the planned programs as youngsters and now really enjoy happy hour at Coconuts :) Through the years we have used the different accommodations that are available and found something to meet our needs every year. The office staff and other employees are always pleasant and helpful. If you want a memorable experience in OC, give the Castle a call.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: falustinia
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time that I've stayed at this hotel. It is wonderful. The employess in the office are very nice. We had an efficiency which is nice for families with children. The rooms are clean and have a dvd/vcr and the disney channel. Also the hotel has a schedule of activities for the kids, like shows, face painting, and more. Its a very kid friendly hotel, also a few steps from the beach with a nice pool. Also, there is a Bar/Grill restaurant that is outside. Very nice setting. A bit pricey, but worth it for the convenience you get.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable family-friendly place to cherich old memories and make new ones”
Reviews.Author: soccerandsurf
Reviews.Content: Some of my earliest memories of the beach were made at Castle in the Sand; my first recollection of the hotel was when I was a pre-schooler in 1968. Since then the "Castle" has been a treasured destination for quick getaways, family reunions and family vacations. The staff is always friendly and accomodating; the rooms clean and you can't beat the location because it is ocean front and within walking distance of the boardwalk, there is a large pool onsite and nearby is miniature golf and other fun activities for people with or without kids. There is no fitness center I am familiar with although there is some pickup out door volleyball in season. Lorenzetti Family

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER return...”
Reviews.Author: NT3
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I booked the Castle in the Sand because I loved the location and the restaurant (and the fact that they had wait-service at the pool and beachfront.) We had booked a “Castle Outpost” because of its affordable price and large size to accommodate our group of six. The location offers easy access to the Coastal Highway, the restaurant was great, and the room was exactly what we expected (note: we didn’t expect too much.) However, I will NEVER return to the Castle in the Sand. For one thing, we checked in on Saturday to find a window missing from the door to the upstairs porch, the screens broken on a front window and the front door, and what can only be described as an infestation of ants in the kitchen (no wonder…there’s no windows or screens in various parts of the house.) We called the front desk to request the window be fixed. Also, almost immediately upon check-in, we were harassed by hotel management and housekeeping. Our first afternoon a woman, whom I later found out was a housekeeper, approached us to stress the importance of keeping our “outpost” clean. She went on to tell us that she remembered us from the year before and that we left her a large mess. This is notable because none of us had ever stayed at the Castle in the Sand. Not the year before, nor ever. She went on to tell us that we gave her “a bad vibe.” Taken aback and sensing hostility, I made sure to note that a window and screen were already broken and that I wanted to make sure I wasn’t charged for it. We went on to request an iron (the one in the room was broken) and a hair dryer (there was none even though there was supposed to be) and thankfully they all arrived promptly. The broken window, however, was not fixed until four days and equally as many calls to the front desk later. Later in the week, the same housekeeper returned to “check in” and to take two of our six dining room chairs to “reupholster.” The icing on the cake came on the final afternoon of our trip when the hotel manager arrived to “lay down some ground rules.” We were informed that the Castle in the Sand “does not do parties” and that the housekeeper informed the manager that she feared we were planning a party for the final night of the trip. It was also at this time when the manager opted to let me know that he would be charging us $120 extra for having too many people staying in the room. I went on to explain that I was never asked for the total number of guests in the room when I made the reservation and assumed that since the hotel website and brochure note that our room fits six that having six people in it would not be a problem. Evidently I was mistaken and would be charged for the additional guests. After he left the same housekeeper returned to “remind us” that she didn’t have time to clean up after us. I told her that there was no mess that would take extra time to clean. I only noted that we ate a lot of junk food and spent a lot of time at the beach so, as a result, there were crumbs and sand that would require vacuuming. She responded by returning an hour later WITH A VACUUM and suggested that I run it through the house. Our group was comprised of mid-twenties professionals not “Senior Week”-ers. We do not complain about less than stellar accommodations, often accepting a few problems (like a broken screen door) in the name of saving money. This is why we opted not to complain about the many problems we encountered with the property including the broken screens, missing window, bugs, dirty lamp shade, broken stove, broken iron, missing hair dryer, dingy carpeting, cable static, or the upstairs toilet that broke near the end of our stay (and we opted to fix ourselves, rather than wait four days to use the bathroom.) Also, admittedly, we spent a lot of time outside during the day and often arrived home after midnight. However, we have visited Ocean City each of the last three years together and never once had a complaint from any other property, let alone been visited multiple times by management or housekeeping because of a “bad vibe.” I should note that there were some bright spots. The “Coconuts” outdoor bar was excellent and the guy who they sent to fix the broken window was extremely helpful (granted he didn’t come until four days after we called, but I pin that on the front desk, not him.) However, this does not make up for the treatment we received from the aforementioned members of the staff. We loved Ocean City and will return next summer, just never again to the Castle in the Sand. Others here seem to have enjoyed their stays. Good for them. We’ll opt to stay somewhere else in Ocean City…perhaps a property that doesn’t “give us a bad vibe.”

Reviews.Title: “Glad we came back!”
Reviews.Author: donnasuerote
Reviews.Content: I love several things about the Castle in the Sand Hotel. It's not a chain and I appreciate that. They did a great job of describing the variety of accomodations. I love the Coconuts bar and grill. The waitstaff in bikinis are more than willing to run a drink out to you, if you are ocean side. I would have like to see a few young men, though! We asked for a late check out and it was granted. We had trouble with the air and they responded immediately, getting it going in less than an hour. The pool is the perfect spot to catch the last couple hours of sunlight. I would like to see them add beach towels OR mention lack of beach towels, when reserving the room. -Devillez 07/06/09

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families.”
Reviews.Author: snedcm
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried about what we would find. We stayed in the North tower, bayside. Our room was clean, the biggest problem was the water pressure in the shower. You had to run around to get wet!!! It also went from hot to cold during shower. Other than that, we really enjoyed it. If you have young kids, the children's activites are nice. "Sunshine" and "Lady Jane" were great. We also liked the beach bar. The pool was great, although a little cold, (it's not heated). Honestly, we usually stay on the boardwalk, ( we like the flurry of activity), and we missed it! It's a good compromise for not staying on boardwalk, if you like the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Family & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: We have 2 weeks old Baby when we arrived, the moment we booked our reservation, Matt was already friendly, he suggested a good time to arrive. We got about 10 hotels to choose from thru our time share RCI, but this one keeps on popping on my computer as one of the best, the price was also fantastic. Upon arrival, Carli, the office lady offered us some place to sit relax or some soft drinks, i thought we were in Carribean, Europe or Africa, then she gave us the best room overlooking the 90 bay bridges. The host at the restaurant offered us a whole lots of meals, drinks, and desserts. Later, the kids were sent to the beach and offered games by Chuck from Europe who is working as student exchange. We were told the Owner, Adam, and Mom are all nice people, as well as the sons and daughters, all are almighty fearing people who has been blessed and are helping people by employing them, giving them shelter and feeding them too, so they can finish college. Workers are locals, USA, Canada, Africa, Europe, Turkey, Poland and Carribean. All the employees are nice and happy. That's why the treated us even nicer. The swimming pools are neat, parking lots are cleaner, they have volleyball, soccer, and tennis. At night there is barbecue and chicken for family. their prices are so reasonable. The bar tenders are so clean and courteous. My wife was very impressed that she want to go again, this time she says at the cottages. Chuck, after work took me for a tour of the Castles, it's like college campus, so glamourous, well lighted, and very secured. Every one should come to the Castle and share the wonderful experience. Mr. & Mrs. Daniel Baiden DanielnBaiden@yahoo.com DBaiden-nimene@gpo.gov

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: mariafw
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and my husband had been led to believe we would get one of the suites that had the wood furniture - an update room. However, we had only two choices when we got there and my husband went to look at both to choose. Well, he told me that the first one that was an upgrade was digusting - not clean, had a TV that was 19" or smaller - very olf. The second room was dirty and the front desk person went to clean the mirrors as they had some stuff on them. Well after seeing my husband's face, I went to look myself. The room was gross - did not smell clean, had stains all over the carpet, the mirrors had been cleaned by then. There was no way that I would spend the night there especially with my kids. I had no certainty that they had cleaned the rest of the room. It was incredibly outdated. Additionally, there were teenagers and young adults roaming around everywhere and coming in and out of rooms. I doubt that there is quiet there. Thankfully, they let us out of our reservations and the person who cleaned the mirrors was very sweet. However, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: giant57
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location for a family beach vacation. The hotel is right on the beach, only a few steps away. Many rooms overlook the ocean. We stayed there with our teenage kids for four nights and were very pleased. Our room was a suite in the north building (the lower 3 floors have a balcony, but be sure to stay on the second or third floor to get a view of the beach). There were two beds in the bedroom, then a full kitchen, and finally a full living room with a foldout sofa overlooking the ocean. The main problem was that the air conditioning unit is in the living room and the cool air has trouble making it to the back bedroom. We bought a small table fan to blow the cool air in, and that helped. The hotel is older and clearly gets a lot of use but our room was clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant with a buffet. The breakfast buffet was OK but I wouldn’t recommend the diner buffet. Instead, eat lunch or diner at the beach bar. There is live music every afternoon. The Olympic size pool is very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for a Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Veronica099
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family in June and we had a great time! We stayed in the Waverly building and had a fantastic view from our balcony! Our son, for some reason, was very intriged by the decorative ivy that grows up the side of the building! Our room was nice and clean and had a little kitchen area which was perfect for us because our son is a picky eater. There were a good bit of high school age kids at the hotel, but that is because it was Senior Week in Ocean City so there were kids everywhere in town and we expected that. They were ok though and we had no trouble with them..we were kids once too. :) The staff was really friendly...one evening when it was rainy, we went into the office to borrow a dvd, which was free, and the guy working at the desk was really nice and even offered some suggestions on what movies he thought our son would enjoy! Overall, this place was great and affordable for us. We loved the beach service because we did not have to drag our son back and forth to the deck area because they delivered our food to us right on the beach. Also, it was like 2 steps to the beach when we left the hotel building. We didn't use the pool because we would rather sit on the beach but it looked beautiful! Only thing that we didn't like was the bit of rain...but nobody can control that but mother nature...we did have some sun though too! We love ocean city and have stayed at many places but so far this is our favorite by far. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR BEACH LOVERS, BUT .......”
Reviews.Author: TAKEATRIP1
Reviews.Content: We arrived slightly early and had no problem checking in. When we got to the room we were a little disappointed at how the room looked compared to the pictures. The pictures must have been taken when the units were brand new. After reading the hotel rules about noise disturbances not being tolerated at all, I was surprised to be kept up half the night, nightly by screaming, partying kids staying at the hotel. Although we felt mislead by the online pictures, and let down by the hotel not enforcing their rules to make for a peaceful stay, the view and location helped us enjoy the stay. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. There was one lady who seemed to be miserable, but luckily I didn;t have to deal with her. If you are a healthy eater it might be hard to find places to dine in ocean city. There is a great new place across the street called the Toucan. They have some healthier options and will modify your order to suit your dietary preference. Take care!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: hslong
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed upon arrival at this hotel. The room did not look much like the online picture. It was dark, dingey, and dated. There were drop-ceiling panels dangling precariously in the bathroom. There was hardly any natural light, so it felt like a cave. The a/c unit is only in the very front of the room, so the bedrooms in the back were stuffy. The couch and beds are not the most comfortable. And we could hear every little noise in the rooms beside, above, and below us. On the plus side, the pool was nice and so was the view. When I mentioned my complaints to the front desk manager, he didn't have a thing to say. I expected a little more for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: iestokes
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights in Ocean City at Castle in the sand. We checked in late (around 11:30 pm) with absolutely no issues. We we got into our room, we were delighted to discover that we had an unobstructed ocean view, which was very nice. The rooms are fair sized and very clean but definitely not luxurious; but with the ocean view I gave them a 4/5. There is a nice outdoor pool and bar that has live music during the afternoons. For the amount we paid, this hotel was an amazing deal. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel--beach service, great pool, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jessafin
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Castles each year for the past 10 years. We stay in the efficiency apartment with an oceanview. The rooms are clean and the kitchenette has everything you need. The pool is great--olympic size--always super clean. The best part is the outdoor cafe with bar and live entertainment. The Castles also offers waitress service on the beach! It is by far the best value in Ocean City--why go pay 500+ per night when you have a great hotel at a reasonable price?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: me3tg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the guest house apartments in Sept. The decor was very out dated and could have defiantly used some updating. Grounds and facilities were well maintained for the most part, just old. The outdoor restaurant / bar were very good and had a fun atmosphere. The pool was large, but cold. The breakfast buffet was not very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pictures that the website posts for the hotel are a little deceiving, it makes it out to be grander than it actually was. Good place to stay overall if you don't require the most modern facilities.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back !!”
Reviews.Author: barbara053
Reviews.Content: My family have been coming to the castle for the last three years and we always leave looking forward to the next year to rebook ....The staff is great , with any problems quickly taken care of... the accomendations (although the decor may be a little outdated)... are charming....it's definitely a good location - home away from home...i highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: oceanWheeling_WV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property in 2006 and booked this year too. The service desk is very helpful and kind. The rooms, while being outdated, are very clean and comfortable. The mattresses were very comfortable and the linens clean. We had a kitchen and it was well stocked and super clean too. The bathroom was also super clean and had everything anyone could need. At this time of year, an Ocean front room with living room, bedroom and kitchen--also a balcony at the Senior rate goes for 64 a night or less. Will book again. Great trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nearby Construction Ruined Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MountainBeachNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed September 16th through the 18th. There was road construction on 38th Street which began before 7 am and ended after 4 pm - while we understand that the hotel has no control over situations as this - to have them tell us to call the township/county and complain was not the response we expected. Some kind of accomodation should have been made by the hotel for this horrible inconvenience in being forced awake at such an early hour while on vacation. I feel a free drink or discount on food would have been a good gesture on their part. The manager never got back to us. Very bad customer relations in our experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBeachlovers
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City Maryland, and we couldn't have found a nicer place to stay. To begin with, the staff was so friendly when I called to book the room and when I called to ask questions before we went. This continued at check in and for our entire our stay. In addition, our room was beautiful. We were told the room had a great view of the ocean, and a great view it was. Facing directly to the beach, we could watch the sun rise from our room or balcony. The room was very clean (and yes we are picky) and the maid service was wonderful. Being beach lovers, we enjoyed the convenience of walking right down to the beach each day. We have traveled a lot and would love returning to the Castle in the Sand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ready for some updates!”
Reviews.Author: uklkb
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on a last minute stay at Castle in the Sand. The reviews seemed to be more on the positive side, so we gave it a shot. It's a great location and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. The room was huge, but looked like something straight out of the 70s. Everything is really old and worn down. The kitchen was fully stocked with a full size fridge, sink, microwave and toaster. The A/C is in the living room, so the bedroom did not cool down. I was fine with the place until I took a shower - there were 3 clumps of someone else's hair in there, the shower curtain was not clean and there were all sorts of different colored mold. That was my biggest turn off. Other than that, plenty of parking that you can stay in after checkout, huge pool and perfect walking distance to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: jwc123
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay through the Hot Deals area on the hotel's website. Received a great rate on an ocean front penthouse room, which was even better than described on the website. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Room was clean and spacious. The view was great! Though checkout time was at 11, we were permitted to leave our car in the lot all day, as well as use the pool and changing facilities before heading home. Waitress service on the beach and at the pool - the drinks were great!

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive review”
Reviews.Author: beachbabyTn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the north tower on the 3rd floor and had a great view. The room does need some updating but the beds were comfortable and the tv has MANY channels. Our room had a small kitchen area that was just enough. The bathroom is very small but the shower head is awesome! The staff is very polite and we were allowed to check-in at 10:30am. That was very accomodating to our day. We loved the live music at Coconuts (the outside hotel restaurant), happy hour and beachside and poolside food and beverage service. The boardwalk ends around 27th and the hotel is on 37th so that gives you an idea of how far the two are. Overall, our stay was great and relaxing! I would go back again. Oh, Phillips seafood on 21st was very yummy!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gymfan76
Reviews.Content: After reading decent reviews and then some bad reviews, I didn't know what to expect. We only stayed one night but our room and stay was better than expected. We stayed in the north castle in a suite on the 3rd floor with a great view of the ocean. Good points: - clean - comfortable living room furniture with enough seating; seemed new (not worn); included sofa bed, 2 arm chairs, 1 ottoman, coffee table - nice dark wood tables, desks - 2 queen beds in bedroom - full kitchen with stove, microwave and clean fridge; stocked with utensils and plates etc.; expandable table - 2 tv's with cable; one with vcr/dvd player - can borrow dvd's from front office - plenty of towels - reasonable rate for suite (tail end of low season) - right on the beach - fairly close to boardwalk - balcony with small table and chairs - ocean view Minor negatives: - front desk staff was kind of aloof - a/c didn't seem to work but fortunately didn't need it - next to boiler room so some noise - fairly thin floors and walls - entrance door to outside (not to common hallway) - entrance door opens into bedroom, not living room - outside looks bit dated but can add to charm We would stay here again for more than a day since the suites are ideal for longer stays (with the kitchen).

Reviews.Title: “Time for an update...”
Reviews.Author: MDG-G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend our anniversary weekend in OC during the SpringFest. Our regular hotel (Quality Inn Beachfront) was fully booked, so we decided we would try Castle in the Sand. A friend of ours from church had recommended it. We stayed in a first floor suite. When we checked in, the staff was completely friendly and wonderfully helpful. No complaints there. We reallly liked the size of and the way the suite was set up. You could walk right out the back door and were no where from the path over the dunes to the beach. It had a full kitchen that was very well stocked, right down to a potato masher! Those were the great things. Here are the problems....Both of the double beds in our room were broken down, the coner of the box spring on one was actually touching the floor! The mattresses on both beds had the smell of mildew. By chance I had a bottle of Fabreze in the car. I sprayed down the beds, carpets and curtains and it helped a little. It is definitely time for some new beds! The walls are paper thin... We could hear everything going on in the rooms on both sides of us. There was a group of women on one side there for a bachelorette party that were quite graphic in their group discussions! LOL....But, it made us think, What are they hearing from us???Geez! Time to pad the walls a little. This hotel has been around for a while, it is definitely time for some updates. Again, the service and front desk are absolutely wonderful. Other than the odor in the bedroom, the room was very clean. If you decide to book, ask for an upper floor and ask if the mattresses have been replaced for the 2008 season.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: shannylovespink
Reviews.Content: Castle in the Sand was not as nice as it looks online. The rooms smell like mildew and cigarette smoke. The decor is really ugly, nothing matches. We did have a little problem with our neighbors, they were really loud and I think there were kids jumping on the beds. I know the hotel cant do anything about that, I just think there are pretty thin walls. If you are staying here, make sure you ask for a higher up room, so you can actually see the ocean. The lower rooms have dunes in front of them, so you'll have a beautiful view of a pile of sand. Our housekeeper was very nice and got us whatever we needed. The pool was freezing and it's behind the hotel, away from the beach. I personally like to be near the ocean as much as possible. The hotel is a little overpriced, I think. I went to Myrtle Beach last year and got a suite with a much bigger kitchen, the hotel had 5 pools and 3 lazy rivers and I paid about $200 less for a whole week. Ocean City needs some newer, updated hotels. There isn't much to pick from in this area. But I do like it in Ocean City. I wouldn't recommend Castle in the Sand.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: timberframer
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome place to stay. I found it to be quite charmimg. The pool is beautiful, although a bit to chilly for a dip. The showers were awesome though. Magnificent ocean views as well as the polite service. Very friendly front desk. Right across the road is the convention center too. I will be back hopefully. Larry

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fun0nvacati0n
Reviews.Content: Awesome Condo for a great deal. Stayed for my birthday and if I could go back a moment in time I would go back and live that week over and over. The condo was better than expected, bigger than my appartment. Kitchen was well stocked. Condo was clean. They do however frown on grilling on the balcony some thing about fire codes. Will be back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brenda90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 10/5/07 to 10/8/07, we had a great time! I booked this hotel after seeing it on line. It l exceeded our expectations!. The room was spacious and clean. There was a restaurant on the premises and the food and service were excellent. The weather was unseasonably hot that weekend so we got to enjoy the beach which was right outside our room., great location. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my friends, the staff was very personable and friendly. We will be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: melace112
Reviews.Content: Everything is old and I must say it is time to clean the carpets! The bathroom and everything in it seemed to be at least 100 years old including the floral wallpaper! The TV was super old and the furniture needed to just be removed and replaced. The window looked as though it would very much allow my son to just fall out. Doors and hallways were dark and it seemed like a good place to find trouble hiding at night. Don't wais your money on this dump!

Reviews.Title: “I Wanted To Like It, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: damous
Reviews.Content: We booked four days at CIS for a getaway and beach time with our two children, ages 6 and 8. I cannot say that the front desk did not treat us well. Our room was not ready and they called me on my cell phone when it was. We had a suite on the first floor between the pool and the restaurant. Things got off to a very bad start the first evening when we found that the sheets left for the pull-out and the ones on our bed were visibly dirty/stained. While we did have two rooms and a kitchenette, it seemed like there was very little space to stretch out. Basically, there was room to walk around the bed and the open pull-out took up all of the living room space. The drying rack supplied for wet clothes took up the kitchen space. I should mention that the desk was more than eager to replace the dirty sheets but then we realized that the LOUD music from the bar blared right into the room our children slept in...through the bathroom and into our room which was already bombarded with noise through the VERY thin Florida windows (slats open and close) coming from the pool. You can pretty much count on music of one sort or another permeating your room from noon-10pm. We returned to our room daily to find that it had been vacuumed and cleaned but don't expect your mother's "clean". There was a lot of smoking in all public areas which proved bothersome. Maryland doesn't have the same "no-smoking" legislation that many states do. The restaurant had a very popular 2-for-1 Happy Hour but beware that ordering one drink means they will bring you two. On some positive notes however, the two ladies who run the children's program in the afternoons were fabulous. Clearly, they themselves, keep many families returning to this hotel. The location is also unbeatable at 37th Street. You are ten blocks up from the end of the Boardwalk and between the two bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrip22
Reviews.Content: Great location steps from the beach, wonderful pool. Loud DJ music till 10pm made it difficult to even stay in our room, which was overlooking the restaurant area - fine if you want to party, too. The kicker was the stained sheets provided for the pull-out couch. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Castle In the Sand-Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vanomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of July. I got an awesome deal on Ocean City's Travel site, we booked 3 nights for around $570 total, a great deal. We arrived to the hotel a bit early, but were greeted warmly and allowed to check in early. The hotel is a group of 3 buildings. They are a bit older, but clean and well kept on the outside. We stayed in the Waverly building. We got an effiency ocean front room with 2 double beds and a balcony. The room was just great, very clean and very up to date. They provided soaps and lotions and even had a little bottle of dish detergent in the kitchen. The little kitchenette was stocked with dishes and utensils, pretty much everything you needed to do a little cooking. The room also had a dvd/vcr player which was kind of neat. The beach front was amazing, honestly Ocean City is one of the cleanest beaches I have ever been on, it was so nice. The hotel had a great little restaurant with outdoor eating and live music which was kind of neat. Overall this was a great place for the money and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: EllenTBO
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Castle in the Sand for years and have always had an enjoyable time. This vacation was no different. The front desk employees were very pleasant, and even called me on my cell phone to let me know when my room was ready. The call came as I was basking on the beach, having a drink the beach waitress brought me. The hotel has an outdoor bar/grill (restaurant) and the waitresses also come down to the beach to serve you whatever you want from their huge menu (food and drinks). They have the best burgers in Ocean City at the best prices. During the day and early evening, they provide live entertainment. We never did get around to playing volleyball, but the court is nice to have at the hotel. And next to the outdoor bar/grill is a separate area with additional lounge chairs and tables. And taking our luggage and other bags up to our room was a breeze with the carts provided and the quick elevator. Being in a hotel on the beach is the best – only a few steps away from the ocean. Another nice thing about the Castle is their olympic size swimming pool. I never felt crowded at the pool, and my husband enjoyed diving off the diving board. And there were plenty of lounge chairs at the pool. Another nice thing about this hotel is their guests – the guests staying at the hotel are very friendly – a very friendly atmosphere. The Penthouse rooms are big, and have a small fridge, which was just enough for us. And a beautiful view of the ocean! Oh, and on nights that you are too tired to go anywhere, you can hang out at the outdoor bar. The outdoor bar staff are extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My son loved it!”
Reviews.Author: betchette
Reviews.Content: We took a long weekend after July 4th to visit with my cousin who goes to College in Maryland. We stayed 3 nights/4days at the Castle in the Sand. I used TripAdvisor to make my decision on where to stay. My husband, son (4 yrs), daughter (7 months) and myself had our own standard room. 2 double beds, mini fridge, bathroom, tv, table and chairs, in room safe and coffee maker. The room was clean. No balcony. With the baby we used the coffee maker to make bottles and I cleaned her stuff in the bathroom sink. We made due. The prices were a tad higher than we would have liked for what we got, but it was considered a holiday weekend. We used the pool and the beach. They offer poolside and beach food service. There is also an outdoor restaurant and bar. We did not eat at the hotel. The hotel is on the beach which is nice. We walked to breakfast. Very convenient hotel. My cousins had their own room with no issues. Recommend for people with kids. On site parking also.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again, glad to leave”
Reviews.Author: whirly08
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews for this hotel, I thought I made a good choice. I can't believe this hotel is rated good and got such good reviews. We stayed in the North Bldg, Waverly Castle, which I don't know how they could call this a castle. We were told we would be on the third floor but was on the second. There was no parking in the alley that the hotel is in. This was one of the noisiest hotels I have ever stayed at. The loud music blarred from the bar all day. The guests made so much noise outside of the rooms going by, getting on the elevator and getting ice. Doors were slamming all of the time. And you can forget sleeping late, they had white mini blinds on the windows so you were up at the crack of dawn. The balcony furniture sucks and the door locks automatically when you go out on the balcony so you have to bring you key. The balcony is pitch dark at night. The room and furniture was old. The wallpaper was worn, the floors and linens were dirty- Yuk!! The spare pillows had stains on them. The pool was so crowded, they were no chairs and when you did find a chair they were so close, you could not even get on them. The only good thing was it was close to the beach. I was really disappointed and was very glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay with small kids or if you want peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JoannaF
Reviews.Content: We tried to stay here with our two young kids but checked out after one day. The noise was awful. Our suite (consists of a queen bed in a very small room, a kitchenette, and a pull out sleeper sofa) overlooked the pool on one end and the bar on the other end. There were kids out at the pool area at all hours and the bar had live music all day. After the band stopped they crank out music on the speakers and it is also very loud. The rooms are pretty outdated and have very old furniture. We complained about the noise and the mgr told us there wasn't a room that was any quieter. We were able to check out early w/o paying for the nights we didn't stay there. We went to the Holiday Inn Suites and it was about the same amount of money and very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but some issues with maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Heloise07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room at this hotel with three other people. They shared the two queens bedroom and we got the sleeper sofa in the living room. I had read the posts on this site before making my reservation. I was expecting a clean, but old hotel room. The room was as I expected. Unfortunately, it meant peeling wallpaper, worn furniture and a bad sofa matress. The beds in the bedroom were much more comfortable. We should have brought our air mattress instead. The AC unit was good enough to cool the entire room, but it had been turned on too late on our arrival day, so the bedroom was stuffy for the first night. We did find enough towels in the bathroom. The view was great. The pool was clean and large. The beach was steps away from our room. This room did what we wanted for the price we wanted considering that we had guests (we got to rent one room instead of two), but I would not go back if it was just the two of us. If you still want to go, here are a few tips. If you do not like loud music, request a room in the North building. The South building overlooks the Coconuts restaurant and they play music all day. If you want an real ocean view and a balcony, request a room on the second or third floor. The first floor view is blocked by the sand dune and the last floors' balcony are enclosed in glass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-A-Way Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GetAWayGalPa
Reviews.Content: My Sister-In-Law and I decided we needed a long weekend away from the everyday stresses (and without our husbands). So we decided to go to the beach for a 4-day weekend. Ocean City, Maryland, here we come! But with so many hotels to choose from, where would we stay? We started with Trip Advisor and based on the reviews we read we were willing to give Castle in the Sand a try. We had never stayed there before. We liked the location, 10 blocks from the Boardwalk (excerise needed), and the best of all, a ocean view room at a reasonable price compared to other area hotels. We had such a terrific weekend! Everything was perfect, 4 days of gorgeous weather and the room was exactly what we needed for the type of stay we planned. The room was a suitable size for the two of us and it was clean. The maids did a good job of tiding up everyday but we did need to remind them to provide us with more towels. The pool bar was convenient. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun Value”
Reviews.Author: stump1015
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip to the Castle in March 2007. Wanted to return to Ocean City where my parents used to take us as kids 25-30 years ago. Searching and reviewing hotels on the internet was somewhat time consuming and concerned me. Looked for a fair rate for what was offered. I had no help or outside referral. Castle in the Sand was my choice. Great, central location right in the middle of Ocean City. Nice clean beach, umbrella rentals and all right there. Private gated parking lot was secure. Very friendly staff at all times. Our room in the castle south was a small suite, but just what I expected based on the hotel discription. Staying on the requested 3rd floor, we had a great view of the ocean to the east and wonderful swimming pool on the west. Pool was huge and life guards were nice. Enjoyed hearing some of the reggae music on balcony from coconuts bar below. Made us feel as if we were on a tropical island somewhere. All in all we were very happy with the stay. It was a great value for what we paid. The only small issue was the flooring and carpets need cleaned. They made our feet kinda soiled walking around. Kitchen sink drain was slow and so was shower. They were not really dirty just need cleaned out. Staff was always ready to help and see to our needs. We'll be going back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, great time”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyRed1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Waverly Castle building last week (4th floor) and loved it. It was our first stay in Ocean City based on a friends reccomendation and it will not be our last. The place is exactly, if not better, then advertised. Clean clean clean, right on the beach, and a bar and place to eat on premises (not that anything is not within walking distance). The place is not a four star resort (not that I saw one during my entire stay) and looks from the outside a little outdated but the inside is totally different. It looks as if was somewhat recently redone and I cannot stress the cleanliness. The office staff was helpful and pleasant. It is a ten minute walk to the boardwalk where all the attractions are but the bus is two bucks a day for unlimited rides and runs all night so that was really not an issue. I can imagine a hotel on the boardwalk would be a bit noisy at night so we liked not being on there and having some seclusion. The website for the hotel does not do it justice. The view was worth the price which was cheap compared to everything else especially those right on the boardwalk. The wait staff at Coconuts (the local eatery on the premises) was some of the nicest people we have had wait on us and was as good as the several cruises we have been on and how can you complain at all you can eat crab legs for two people for fifty bucks? You can't. Overall if your looking for a nice clean place for a laid back vacation RIGHT ON the beach this should be one of your picks. Me and the wife will definitly be back next summer if not this September when it starts cooling down here in NY.

Reviews.Title: “FUN At the Castle”
Reviews.Author: Happymom7
Reviews.Content: Hello, Our family booked 3 rooms for 2 nights on the first floor, it was wonderful! The reservation person helped us decide our needs and our rooms were right on the beach. Each room was clean and the kitchenettes most useful with small children. The beds were comfortable. Private parking, suggestions on where to eat, even though food was available on sight was appreciated. We wish our time permitted a longer, we would stay again and love it. The entire staff was marvelous. Thanks, Castle in the Sand................The Dean family from Utah

Reviews.Title: “ALway a wonderfule time”
Reviews.Author: yellat
Reviews.Content: over the past 8 years I have stayed at Castle in the sand, this year was the best time ever. Everyone is alway nice and willing to assist in anyway they can.... I will never consider staying with anyone else

Reviews.Title: “Always friendly, reliable and consistent....”
Reviews.Author: Cody447
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Ocean City for the Ward World Wildfowl Carving Competition, we stay at Castle in the Sand. We usually book the same "bungalow apartment". We've stayed there many times over the past years and have never been disappointed. Reservations were easy to make over the phone, the staff is friendly, check-in/check-out was easy and the apartment was clean. If the hotel would install a bigger shower and improve the water pressure, it would be perfect! I guess we've gotten use to to it though...part of the apartment's "character"...lol. If there is one compliment I can give the "Castle", it is the fact that they are always friendly, reliable and consistent....and that is why we stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but overly priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: psmelrose92
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Ocean City every few years since 1979 and even though this hotel was one of the nicer ones I have stayed at, I feel its overpriced for what you get. Considering the cost, I would've expected more extras and for that reason alone, I won't stay there in the future unless there is no place else to go. There are too many other hotels in Ocean City for less money that are just as nice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Senior Rates”
Reviews.Author: Jantravels
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay here. Twice I came for the mystery weekend which was great fun. The other times were festival times in Ocean City. I am senior citizen and appreciate the senior rates they give which makes it so affordable..The rooms are clean and pleasant with great service. It is family friendly. Each time i stayed there my room had a kitchenette with complimentry coffee and I do love my coffee first thing in the morning. It also has a balcony that faces the ocean. I always recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: occhecking
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel during the Easter weekend. Although the weather was not perfect, we enjoyed our stay regardless. The main attraction of the hotel is its location and the affordable rates. Good: The room is clean and organized; The ocean view is beautiful; Walk right to the beach from the hotel; On-site restaurants; Kitchen has microwave, dishes, coffee maker, utensils and toaster; Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Bad: The noise level is high for us since we have a young child and he needs to sleep early. The first night we heard teenagers yelling, running on the balcony and slamming doors. Because the common balcony is wood-made, it is very loud when someone is running on it. Improvement: The heat/AC is not central. The heat/AC is in the living room. When turned up the heat in the living room made the room too hot, the bedroom was still too cold. And it was very uncomfortable sitting in the sofa because the heat was blowing directly on us. I also wish they have a hand-held shower head in the bathroom. It makes easier to wash a young child. Tips: The kitchen is quite well-equipped. However, don’t forget to bring your own paper towel if you have children with you. Also, if you would like to cook during your stay, make sure to bring things like sugar, salt, pepper and cooking oil. Beverage is very expensive in Ocean city. Bring enough drinks will save you a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough ...”
Reviews.Author: nhej
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days during the end of summer, Labor Day weekend. The hotel was ok, not much to go gaga about, though I think they need to start thinking to UPDATE !!(noticed they had really old table lamps and appliances) Excellent service though, can't say enough of their staff. We came in while there was a storm, our window was leaking (we had an oceanfront room) and since they were fully booked due to the holiday and cannot transfer us to another room, they made all the effort to make us comfortable and were very attending to our needs. Great location, and easy access to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: acchen
Reviews.Content: This property is one-of-a-kind, it consists of several buildings none higher than 5 floors and several townhouse/cottages. The property covers an entire block but because of the low density the beachfront is never crowded and parking is easy on a gate controlled lot. The enormous pool is on the West side so it receives afternoon sun. They probably have the last diving board in Ocean City. The pool is at least 25 yards long, I've seen adults swimming laps in the morning. During the summer season there is an open-air grill/bar called Coconuts. At lunchtime it is easy to walk up from the beach and simply sit down and enjoy sandwiches and burgers at Coconuts. They even offer beach-side service of drinks and food. On a lower floor in one of the buildings there is an all-you-can-eat breakfast and dinner. We have not eaten there so I cannot attest to the food, but it is convenient. We stayed in a North Building unit with an oceanfront view. The size of the unit was very large consisting of a bedroom with two beds, full kitchen, bathroom, and living room with a sleep sofa. These are not plush accomodations but everything is clean and in working order. There are drying racks that can be used on the balcony to dry towels and bathing suits. The bedroom has a ceiling fan operated by remote control. There are two TV sets with numerous cable channels. The location is terrific. You are within easy walking distance of many restaurants, The Fractured Prune donut shop is wonderful. The Mad Hatter across the street serves terrific sandwiches, homemade soup, and subs at a reasonable price. There are several surf shops nearby, Doc, at Ocean Atlantic is particularly personable and knowledgeable about the local surfing scene. Castle-in-the-Sand is owned and operated by a family. Members of the family are onsite every day. They truly care about customer service and if you have a problem or concern, it is adressed quickly. A window blind was broken in our room and someone was there is less than 10 minutes. All the staff are friendly and professional. During the summer, Lady Sunshine runs a childrens' activity program in the afternoons and it's great. They have Pirate Day and lots of arts and crafts as well as magic demonstrations and juggling lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: shoreocgirl
Reviews.Content: Great time - enjoyed the cleanliness of the rooms. Housekeeping staff was friendly. Kids activities were fun! Enjoyed Coconuts Bar and Grill!

Reviews.Title: “The Castle is not medieval!”
Reviews.Author: nabell
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully well-run place to stay. We stayed in an ocean-front efficiency. It was very large; the mini-kitchen was equipped with a coffee maker, dishes, a stove, microwave and a nice sized mini-refrigerator. All of the staff were helpful and friendly, the environment very clean, and all of the details that make a stay enjoyable were thought of by them. For instance: the shower/foot shower for beach exit had mats so that washed off sand stayed off; there was a problem with the pool bathroom and the guard on duty had the tools and was willing to attend to the problem mmediately ; we arrived early and they called us when our room was ready. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at The Castle, and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castle in the Sand Waverly Castle the last week of June. I was very happy with how clean the room was, the maid came daily and cleaned the rooms and they were constantly cleaning/mopping the halls and stairwells to get rid of the sand people brought up from the beach. Much different than other beach hotels I stayed at. The section of the hotel we stayed at was very quiet, and it was not high up (only 5 floors) so there was not a long wait for the elevator and it was easy to take the steps. There was plenty of parking, which they gave you a gate pass to get into the lot so they did not have other people not staying there filling up all the spots. The beach was pretty and there was limited beach partying going on at night. The pool was nice too, and my kids enjoyed it. The only thing I wish was different was the size of the refrigerator, I would have prefered a full size one instead of the "under the counter" one, because it was impossible to keep icecream cold. I like to cook to help save money, and it was hard with such a small fridge. (But this stated when I reserved the room, so it was not a fault of the hotel.). We enjoyed our stay and the kids were sad that we had to come back home!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Castle in the Sand!”
Reviews.Author: norm911
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from our 4th annual 4th of July trip to Ocean City, and as always we stayed at Castle in the Sand. This is one of the most fun places we visit, and we absolutely love this hotel. Great location, great restaurants, the ybring you drinks on the beach, awesome pool, very kid-friendly, and the staff is awesome. We recommend this hotel to all of our friends, and this year we brought two other couples with us. Thanks again Castle in the Sand! We had a great time, as always. Norm Laudermilch

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an ocenfront efficiency, non-smoking. The view of the ocean, beach w/ dunes and grasses was a welcome sight; balcony w/ privacy on either side made sitting out enjoyable. All needed ammenities were tucked away in small kitchen, right down to the bottle opener; plenty of fresh linens in the ample bathroom. Within walking distance were a great crab house (Higgins') a good deli and liquor store (Anthony's) and just ten blocks away the famous O.C. boardwalk. Umbrellas on the beach at a reasonable price. We didn't use the pool so no comment there. No missing the World Cup soccer games given we had cable TV. All-in-all a very enjoyable stay - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “okay good and bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on reviews. There was some good some bad. First the bad the outdoor pool is NOT heated. It was to cold for my kids to get in. Also there were a large number of young people not controlled. The management said they had talked with them making noise at night but they wouldn't listen. I did not get much sleep. Between the noise, door slamming, loud talking, and them waking my children, it was not a fun night. Maybe it was the time of year but I've stayed in OC before at this time and didn't have as much of a problem. Now for the good. The check in is awesome. The people are nice, fast, and even let us know when the room was ready early. They told us to use the hotel amenities until the room was ready. The beach is only a few steps away with easy access. If you need anything towels, etc. they get it right away. When I did complain about the noise the person listened said they would talk to the teenagers again and would try to fix the problem. If it were not for the uncontrolled young people it would have been a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Castle”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 3 young children ages 6, 4, and 17 months, just returned from the family-friendly Castle in the Sand, having stayed there over the Memorial Day Weekend. I did not know what to expect as we have always rented a house in Bethany in the summer and this was our first time booking a hotel in Ocean City. I discovered an internet deal for the Memorial Day Weekend that seemed too good to be true...3 days/2 nights for $260 in a 1 bedroom cottage/apartment. I can safely say that our experience at the Castle exceeded my expectations. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly and knowledgable front desk person who had us registered and ready to go to our apartment in under 3 minutes. There was plenty of parking in front and behind the cottage. The place was very clean and homey, and we had a very nice kitchen complete with large refrigerator, coffee maker, dishes, and silverware. We saved money by being able to prepare some meals in our kitchen. The kids were very happy to have a full selection of cable TV offerings and a VCR. The shower was always hot and stayed hot. I appreciated how fast we were provided with additional towels and blankets once we called the front desk. The staff really emphasized customer satisfaction. The hotel offered a very delicious breakfast buffet that was very reasonably priced...2 of our kids ate free. The hotel sits directly on the beach and there is always activity there including volleyball and socializing with direct access to the beach. The pool area was very neat and clean and our children made fast friends with some other children staying there. The hotel is located just 10 blocks from the end of the boardwalk and a few blocks from a great putt putt golf center. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value and very good hospitality. We have already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have stayed here atleast 6 times. We have always found the staff and all personel to be friendly, helpful and accommidating. They have gone above and beyond to help our family with my husbands health issues. The rooms are always clean and inspected before you are allowed to go in. We have always eaten at their buffet and have enjoyed it and offers a moderate price compared to other OC buffets. We intend to go back again early fall. Their senior program is a blessing for fixed income seniors.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to crash for a girls-weekend-away! My friend and I just needed a place to stay and our only requirements were an ocean side room and a refrigerator. We also wanted to be near some of the nightlife but we knew we could take the bus. I wasn't expecting much... but I turned out to be pleasantly surprised. Castle North suite 1st floor, although our view was obstructed by the dune, we had been warned of that at the time of the reservation, so no big deal. Easy beach access, all the basic amenitites and above all surprisingly clean. I was so afraid that we'd arrive and it would look like spring break-ers had been there before, but it didn't. The room was clean and neat, the kitchen and bathroom were spotless, and it was dry and didn't have the sticky feel of a beach hotel. The kitchen was so convenient, and we loved the stereo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying how much I love this hotel! I have gone here for the past 5 years only because of how much I love it. I believe Catsle in the Sand is truly a family-oriented place to stay and relax. Being right on the beach, there's never an inconvenience. It even has a beautiful pool. Eevryone working there is kind and down to earth. I know that almost everybody can have a really great time here.
